story:
Hello,
I am Jessica Opoku and I am currently a senior at Mastery Charter High School Thomas Campus in Philadelphia, PA. As a college bound senior, I am realizing how expensive a college education is. Although the money is a lot, I am determined to meet my goal and attend the college of my dreams. Determined, I am searching for various scholarships that will help cover the cost of attendance at my dream school Spelman College. I realize that in order to receive a college degree and become a future Oncologist, every little bit counts.

As part of a scholarship fund raising organization known as Delta Sigma Theta Jabberwock Scholarship Program, the more money I am able to raise, the more money I receive to fund my college education. By raising $1000 in conjunction with the funds I have raised from selling candy for the past two years, I will be one step closer to achieving my dream. If I am unable to reach my entire goal, I will use the funds I have raised to finance a portion of my college education.

By helping me raise funds to help to pay for my college education, you will be helping me become a Physician that will one day study oncology and remedies that may help battle this disease. Not only that, but you will also be helping out a Ghanaian American achieve her goal and make her family of immigrants proud. By helping me become one step closer to paying for my college, I will be becoming a role model for my younger siblings and a role model for other young girls with a dream as well.

story:
What's going on here?

It's time! I've been practicing yoga for more than six years, and recently became involved with Wanderlust Yoga Festivals as a Wayfarer ambassador. After attending Wanderlust Colorado in 2013, I've come to find deeper meaning within my yoga practice. In November, Wanderlust announced its new yoga teacher training program, and I knew in my heart this is the perfect next step on my journey to help achieve my intentions of being the best version of Jenny that I can be. 

As a mother of two, wife and business partner of an advertising agency, I have a constant energy pull from all directions. Through years of self-exploration, I have found that practicing yoga, including prayanama and asanas, are a perfect way to maintain a balanced and healthy mind and body. 

My goal is to complete the 50-hour training offered in 2014 at Wanderlust Aspen-Snowmass, with future goals of completing the remaining 150 hours at forthcoming festivals. The program is perfect for my lifestyle: an eight-day intensive training in conjunction with the Wanderlust Festival, with pre-work completed virtually beforehand. Most teacher training programs require weekly commitments for several months, which is difficult to achieve with a young family.

Where does the money go?

The 2014 Wanderlust Yoga teacher training that I will attend is located at Aspen-Snowmass in Colorado. So, not only will I need funds for the training itself, I'll also need to consider travel, lodging and food expenses during my time away from my family.

Here is a summary of the fees that I will incur:

  • Wanderlust Yoga - Module 1/50-Hour Training: $900
  • Round-trip Airfare from Wichita, Kansas to Aspen, Colorado: $400 round trip
  • Lodging in Aspen-Snowmass from June 28 to July 1: $600
  • Food/entertainment expenses for 10-day trip: $750

Interested in more information about Wanderlust Yoga and the teacher training program? You can learn more here!

How can you help?

I'm open to any contributions, whether it's $5 or $50. But even if you can't contribute monetary funds, you can still help by sharing my campaign with others to help get the word out. Sure, it requires you to be open and vulnerable, but isn't that how most great things happen in this universe? You never know what kind of connections you can make if you just reach out and tell people what you need.

story:
// WOWZERS FESTIVAL //

// 8-9 MARCH 2014 // LONDON //

Kicking off on International Women’s Day, Wowzers is a community-led festival celebrating the creativity of women and girls around the globe.

Over two inspirational days, Wowzers will play host to an exciting array of activities, from workshops and interactive talks to musical performances, art exhibitions and late-night DJs! It will provide an opportunity for women and girls of all backgrounds to gain inspiration, learn from peers, test out their ideas, innovate, and celebrate their achievements. Contributing organisations already confirmed include the girls are, Oguntê, Irreverent Dance, Storm in a Teacup, Black Feminists, Girl Germs, Chayn Pakistan, and Fanny Pack with many more to be announced... 


WHAT'S THE IDEA?

Wowzers was set up by a small team of passionate and experienced event organisers who recognised a need for a dynamic, inclusive and fresh approach. Our mission is to create a space for all corners of feminism in order to advance emerging issues and to nurture up-and-coming talent, while recognising the intersections with race, class, disability, age and LGBTQ issues.

HOW DOES IT WORK?

It's simple really - you attend for free and are invited to donate towards sessions or activities on a “pay what you can” basis at all levels. Organisations contribute what they are able to, financially and in-kind. We invite everyone who makes a contribution to help us shape the weekend’s activities by proposing sessions and activities they would like to run!

Running events in this format is what we do best. It means the event’s content is entirely crowd-sourced and funded by you. It is very much your event, an event by the community, for the community - we just provide the framework and cover the logistics.

This approach drives down costs phenomenally, however, we still need a certain level of money to get the show on the road. The more money we can raise the better we can make the festival!

WHY DONATE?

By donating you can help maximise participation from all sections of the community by enabling us to keep the event free to attend. Wowzers is a not-for-profit event so all your generous donations will go towards making it as interactive and inclusive as possible. In addition, everyone who donates will have the opportunity to shape the weekend’s activities by proposing a session.

Think of it like this: Remember that sexism, the patriarchy, and misogyny still exist. Now picture your donation to Wowzers like securing a 'Misogyny Credit' that's help wiping out discrimination by opening up a radically inclusive feminist space on International Women's Day. 

It's like buying carbon credits, but more fun.

Any surplus from 2014’s event will be put towards another (hopefully even bigger and better) event in 2015.

WANT TO ATTEND OR LEARN MORE?

Great! You can find more details on our website: www.wowzersfest.org

story:
Hi.  Thank you for reading.

Please allow me to tell you briefly about myself.  I am currently one year into a two year volunteer service, living in the Gambia, West Africa.  I work with the Ministry of Basic and Secondary Education and the Gambia Basketball Association.  Prior to coming to Africa, I worked for Flowing Wells School District in Tucson, AZ as a teacher and a coach.  

I met Lamin at about 10 PM one evening on my way home from the office.  To get home, I take 2 vehicles, the second of which drops me at the top of my street and I have to walk a couple kilometers "inside" to get to my compound.  At the top of my street, I can pay 8 dalasis (a quarter) and get a ride to my junction. The vehicle is called a gelli gelli and is an old van that is filled with about 20 passengers.  Lamin, thirteen years old, was working as a apprentee on this vehicle.  An apprentee calls out to potential customers, helps load passangers belongings, makes sure everybody has a seat, collects money, and distributes change.  This is not an easy job.  Usually apprentees are not 12 years old; they are usually at least 18.  Lamin is a different kind of kid.  He is tough, street smart, trustworthy, and when I met him, very sick.  After a couple months and countless trips to private clinics, the MRC, and the Banjul Teaching Hospital, Lamin has been diagnosed with extra-pulmonary Tuberculosis.  This is not contagious because it is not in his lungs but has relocated to his lymphnodes.  It will take 6-12 months of an antibiotic compound to get well.  The good news is, Lamin is getting his power back.  He is also getting his smile back.  You can learn a little more about that by checking out a few blogs written about him at http://hugsfromsara.wordpress.com/2013/04/13/lamin/ and http://hugsfromsara.wordpress.com/2013/05/24/knock-knock-knock/.

Lamin is an orphan who is taken care of by his Grandma to the best of her ability.  She is a fish seller at the market and has many children to take care of.  Lamin has been sick on and off his entire life and has never been properly diagnosed.  It is not easy to get good medical attention in the Gambia.  Now that he is on his way to getting better, Lamin wants to go to school.  He has went to school in the past and even though he is a bit behind, will catch up quickly.  He speaks English as well as most any boy his age who has the opportunity to go to school.  He is very anxious to learn to read and write.  It is currently summer break in the Gambia and my goal is to have Lamin in school at the start of the next school year.  I have one more year in which I will be able to see him off to a good start and establish the necessary support system.  

Working as a volunteer, I am able to directly contribute to causes that are legitimate and deserving.  The problem is that when situations like this one find me, I do not always have the financial resources to take action.  In my role here, I am paid the equivalent of a Gambian school teacher and this equates to about $200 a month.  You contribution will support Lamin through the next two years of his education.  At this point, I will be in the United States earning a salary and will be able to pick up where you generous support left off.  The donation will go to tuition, school supplies, school clothes, lunch money (which will be paid to my neighbor whom is a shop keeper and will ensure Lamin has something to eat everyday), and tutoring to get him caught up as he has been out of school for a while.  This project is sustainable because of my relationship with people in my community who will be here assisting after I am gone and my relationship with head teachers at Upper Basic Schools that I work.  Through my primary project I communicate with many Gambian teachers and principals online and because of this I will be able to continue sposoring Lamin after I have left the Gambia.  

 

Ebrima is a boy by whom I hope to do right before I go home.  I met hime on a trek through the Gambian countryside.  This boy, from a small village called Mandinary, treked miles and miles with us that day.  He was not annoying (as small boys can sometimes be), he was actually quite a good guide, and although our "official" toubab guide assured us he knew the route, I personally felt more comfortable having Ebrima as part of our group.  I had been in the Gambia for less than a month at this time and was wrapped up in the newness of it all.  I gave this boy my cell phone number before he left us that day.  After this, I learned of Ebrima's greatest quality.  Persistence.  Everytime Ebrima got some cell phone credit he would call or text me.  He knew little to no English at the time so these messages were hard to understand.  He wanted to go to school.  He called and greeted me many times before he finally had somebody take the phone and let his request be known.  So I travelled to Mandinary with the idea that for a few hundred dalasis I would be able to get Ebrima in to school.  If I could send a boy to school for the price of what you would spend on one dinner in America, I had to do it, right?  When I got to the school and sat down with the head teacher, I realized it wouldn't be so simple.  Ebrima was thirteen, but had never been to school.  He would have to start in third grade.  This was not ideal for anybody.  We would need to tutor him intensively so he could move through the grades more quickly than his peers.  He didn't need to catch up with the children his age who had started school on time but needed to get a little farther along.  Hiring a tutor was not something that fit into my budget.  He also needed a uniform, lunch money, etc.  I understand all of these things now, but at the time I was definitely knee deep in my learning curve.  With this new understanding of what it would take to sponsor a Gambian student, I paid Ebrima's tuition for the year, bought him notebooks, gave his head-teacher lunch money for a month, bought him 2 uniforms, and paid for a tutor for one month.  This is where my support for Ebrima stopped.  I know he needed more but I am not able to provide it.  What he needs is not really all that much but unfortunately, more than I can give.  His English is much better, both written in verbal, after one year.  I have such a respect for Ebrima's persistence and demeanor that I want to be able to give him this opportunity.  

The situations with the two boys are nearly the same.  These numbers are not exact but good representations of how your donations will be spent.

 

(d33 = 1US$)

Ebrima

Tuition d200 per term x 3 terms x 2 years = d1200

School supplies and books d500 per year = d1000

Uniform d500 per year = d1000

Tutoring d300 per month x 6 months x 2 years = d3600

Lunch money d5 x 200 days x 2 years = d2000

 

Lamin

Tuition d200 per term x 3 terms x 2 years = d1200

School supplies and books d500 per year = d1000

Uniform d500 per year = d1000

Tutoring d300 per month x 6 months x 2 years = d3600

Lunch money d5 x 200 days x 2 years = d2000

 

Total 

d16,600

$503.00


If the project is overfunded, the difference will be used to purchase a bike for Lamin, increase lunch money (d5 buys half a bread with chocolate, think half a baguette with nutella), and extend the tutoring to 9 months out of the year.  

Thank you in advance for taking the time to read these boys stories.  If you are unable to contribute financially, sharing this with your friends, family, acquantances, and colleagues via word of mouth, social media, or email is an equally important contribution to the cause.  

Justin

story:
Campain Name: YENZ Organizational Development Fund

Objective: Jump-start the organization's continued development and its operations. 

Brief Description of the Organization (also check our website for more info http://www.zambianentrepreneursnetwork.org/)

The Youth Entrepreneurs Network of Zambia-YENZ is a locally-bred, youth-driven, non-political and non-profit youth business association and entrepreneur support network of choice, designed to be a collaborative platform for the availing of innovative, appropriate, practical and sustainable solutions to some of the major challenges that undermine sustainable youth enterprise development in Zambia. The organization is a multi-sector business association, encompassing youth entrepreneurs in the ages 20-40 years old drawn from different business sectors within Zambia, with a collective goal of fostering sustainable enterprise development among the membership.

The Youth Entrepreneurs Network of Zambia was founded in July 2010 by Paul Nyambe, a growth-oriented Zambian youth entrepreneur based in Lusaka. YENZ is registered with the National Youth Development Council (NYDC),in accordance with the Act of Parliament No. 7 of 1986 and Cap 144 of the laws of Zambia. The organization is still in its initial development stage and is as such challenged to access support from mainstream sources. This has in effect slowed its effective development and as such only officially started to operate in mid-2012.

The organization is designed to have a national reach in form of regional and or district chapters, in selected regions of the country where local entrepreneurs exhibit interest for the idea but shall initially operate within the Lusaka urban district of Zambia, which shall also be home to the National Entrepreneurs' Centre (NEC). The NEC shall be the activity hub of the organization, also providing physical space for the association's programs and activities as well as physical networking and learning infrastructure and facilities for the membership.

The specific objectives of the Youth Entrepreneurs Network of Zambia are:

  1. To promote and facilitate peer to peer networking and partnerships among start up, developing and developed entrepreneurs doing business in Zambia, as a first line business challenge alleviation strategy. Through the provision of tailored business matching and networking services and facilities among other strategies.
  2. To mediate and facilitate for increased access to business financing opportunities for the membership, through strategic collaborations and partnerships with relevant stakeholders including banks, government and other organizations among other strategies.
  3. To foster business and entrepreneurial knowledge development among the membership, through among other strategies the provision of tailored knowledge development services and facilities.
  4. To act as voice for the membership on matters relating to their common interest through trade policy dialogue and advocacy locally and internationally.
  5. To act as an in-house information dissemination platform for the membership on matters of common interest, such as relating to business regulatory, statutory and opportunity, through strategic collaborations and partnerships with relevant information sources.

 

Specific Targets for this Fundraising Campaign:-

-          Procure atleast 5 desktop computers and 2 laptops for member-shared use and administrative purposes accordingly. 

-          Internet connection

-          Procure a projector

-          Procure selected business/entrepreneurial knowledge development books to effect our Entrepreneurial Library Facility for shared reading among the membership.

-          Procurement of organizational promotional activities and materials.  

-          Create an ideal overall base for the effective continued development of the organization.

 

Expected Outcomes

-          Enhanced communication and engagement with the membership and other stakeholders.

-          Effective management of administrative tasks.

-          Be able with the use of computers and projector to implement the Ice House Entrepreneurship Program (IHEP) among the membership and also offer it to the general public in Zambia - The IHEP is a Kauffman Foundation-endorsed entrepreneurial mindset development learning program developed and promoted by the Entrepreneurial Learning Initiative-ELI of the USA.

-          Accelerated membership recruitment through increased organizational marketing and communications.

-          Increased stakeholder confidence in the organization and its mission hence increased chances for future mainstream cooperation and support.

If you are interested to support us achieve our mission in any other way apart from contributing to this campaign, please feel free to contact Paul Nyambe at youthentrepreneurs@zambia.co.zm  or at info@zambianentrepreneursnetwork.org
story_txt:
Campain Name: YENZ Organizational Development Fund
Objective: Jump-start the organization's continued development and its operations. 
Brief Description of the Organization (also check our website for more info http://www.zambianentrepreneursnetwork.org/)
The Youth Entrepreneurs Network of Zambia-YENZ is a locally-bred, youth-driven, non-political and non-profit youth business association and entrepreneur support network of choice, designed to be a collaborative platform for the availing of innovative, appropriate, practical and sustainable solutions to some of the major challenges that undermine sustainable youth enterprise development in Zambia. The organization is a multi-sector business association, encompassing youth entrepreneurs in the ages 20-40 years old drawn from different business sectors within Zambia, with a collective goal of fostering sustainable enterprise development among the membership.
The Youth Entrepreneurs Network of Zambia was founded in July 2010 by Paul Nyambe, a growth-oriented Zambian youth entrepreneur based in Lusaka. YENZ is registered with the National Youth Development Council (NYDC),in accordance with the Act of Parliament No. 7 of 1986 and Cap 144 of the laws of Zambia. The organization is still in its initial development stage and is as such challenged to access support from mainstream sources. This has in effect slowed its effective development and as such only officially started to operate in mid-2012.
The organization is designed to have a national reach in form of regional and or district chapters, in selected regions of the country where local entrepreneurs exhibit interest for the idea but shall initially operate within the Lusaka urban district of Zambia, which shall also be home to the National Entrepreneurs' Centre (NEC). The NEC shall be the activity hub of the organization, also providing physical space for the association's programs and activities as well as physical networking and learning infrastructure and facilities for the membership.
The specific objectives of the Youth Entrepreneurs Network of Zambia are:

To promote and facilitate peer to peer networking and partnerships among start up, developing and developed entrepreneurs doing business in Zambia, as a first line business challenge alleviation strategy. Through the provision of tailored business matching and networking services and facilities among other strategies.
To mediate and facilitate for increased access to business financing opportunities for the membership, through strategic collaborations and partnerships with relevant stakeholders including banks, government and other organizations among other strategies.
To foster business and entrepreneurial knowledge development among the membership, through among other strategies the provision of tailored knowledge development services and facilities.
To act as voice for the membership on matters relating to their common interest through trade policy dialogue and advocacy locally and internationally.
To act as an in-house information dissemination platform for the membership on matters of common interest, such as relating to business regulatory, statutory and opportunity, through strategic collaborations and partnerships with relevant information sources.

 
Specific Targets for this Fundraising Campaign:-
-          Procure atleast 5 desktop computers and 2 laptops for member-shared use and administrative purposes accordingly. 
-          Internet connection
-          Procure a projector
-          Procure selected business/entrepreneurial knowledge development books to effect our Entrepreneurial Library Facility for shared reading among the membership.
-          Procurement of organizational promotional activities and materials.  
-          Create an ideal overall base for the effective continued development of the organization.
 
Expected Outcomes
-          Enhanced communication and engagement with the membership and other stakeholders.
-          Effective management of administrative tasks.
-          Be able with the use of computers and projector to implement the Ice House Entrepreneurship Program (IHEP) among the membership and also offer it to the general public in Zambia - The IHEP is a Kauffman Foundation-endorsed entrepreneurial mindset development learning program developed and promoted by the Entrepreneurial Learning Initiative-ELI of the USA.
-          Accelerated membership recruitment through increased organizational marketing and communications.
-          Increased stakeholder confidence in the organization and its mission hence increased chances for future mainstream cooperation and support.
If you are interested to support us achieve our mission in any other way apart from contributing to this campaign, please feel free to contact Paul Nyambe at youthentrepreneurs@zambia.co.zm  or at info@zambianentrepreneursnetwork.org

story:
Who am I?

Hello! My name is Jackie! I work full time for Knox County in Knoxville, TN. I love to sew so that is what I do in my spare time! My mom started teaching me to sew when I was 9 and I haven't stopped!

Last year I was asked by One Vision Intl. to go on a mission trip to Haiti to begin a sewing project with the girls living in an orphanage. I went on the trip and spent three days working with the girls, teaching them how to use sewing machines and preparing them to learn to make clothing. In Haiti, sewing skills could change a girl's life.

This campaign is important to me because it will help me get back to Haiti and the girls who are anxiously awaiting our arrival.

 

Cost

The cost of the trip is $1,600. This cost covers airfare, lodging and transportation in Haiti, and security.

 

So What Do You Get?!

As a thank-you for your contributions, there are a few AWESOME PERKS involved! For a contribution of $10, you will receive a personalized thank-you and picture of the sewing project! For contribution of $12, you will receive a personalized thank-you and hand-made fabric keychain. For your contribution of $20, you will provide a girl in the orphanage with a handmade pillowcase dress and you will receive a personalized thank-you with a picture of the girl who received your gift. For a contribution of $25, you will receive a personalized thank-you and a handmade wristlet (large enough to hold cash, cards, and cell phone). For a contribution of $50, you will receive a personalized thank-you and handmade purse. For contributions of $100 or more, you will receive a personalized thank-you, a handmade purse and wristlet, as well as supply a girl in the orphanage with a new dress.

For those who want to give outside of the US:I will not be able to send any items due to high shipping costs.  I will send you pictures via email if you request them 

If I receive more than my goal amount, the money will go toward supplies for the sewing project.

 

The Impact

The sewing project in Haiti will have a great impact in the lives of these girls. A lot of children in orphanages in Haiti do have families. These families were unable to provide the basic necessities for survival and opted to give up their children so that they had a chance for life.

This project is not about handing out freebies. Our goal is to simply walk along the side of these girls through life teaching them a skill. This skill will hopefully lead to a self-sufficient life. These girls will be able to provide for their future families.

I have the opportunity to make a return trip to Haiti in April. The girls are waiting for our return and asking to learn how to make pants and blouses with buttons! With your help, I will return in April to see my girls!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone is in a position to help out financially, but that's okay! Please, if you can, spread the word. Tell friends, family, post this site on facebook, show someone a photo of the girls, do an interpretive dance explaining the cause - whatever you feel to help get the word out there. You never know who of your friends may feel inclined to donate!

story:
Hi! I'm Matthew Jordan Smith,

Have you ever looked at a child and wondered who they will become in fifty years? What if you could do something today to impact their lives in the future?

For the last two years, I have traveled to every state in America on a quest to empower the next generation and plant the seed of possibilities. I have photographed children from 100 families to create a powerful book titled Future American President: 50 States-100 Families-Infinite Dreams.

Now, I want to take it one step further and not only include your child in the book but put them on the cover. As a professional celebrity photographer, I know how powerful a book or magazine cover can be. Only a few people get to ever experience this, but I would like to change that. I want to create defining moments in the lives of children everywhere by allowing parents the opportunity to have their child on the cover of the new book, Future American President.

Now that the book is completed, we need your help to get it printed. Last year crowd-funding helped us complete the making of the book, but the biggest challenge, and most expensive part of this project, is the printing.

The more we can raise the more we can print and donate. Since we photographed children in every state, we'd love to be able to donate books to children in every state. We need your help to make this happen via your support and by spreading the word to family and friends.

We can print a small amount of book for 10K, but we can really get the books out in a big way if we raise 50k. We only have until the end of July to get the books send the books off for printing and to ensure the books are in your hands by the holidays. Without you this will not happen, so please support today. We must hit our goal!

A percentage from every sale will also go to helping the Boys and Girls Clubs of America who helped me find children all over America. The top tiers of support will give children who may not be able to have this opportunity, the chance to have their picture taken and turned into a one-of-a-kind book cover.

Future American President will be my 3rd book, but it is the first one I've ever received awards from before it was printed. Earlier this year, I received the Image Award for my work related to the project and a month later, I received the Power of Image award in Beijing, China, awarded to 20 photographers from around the world who are making a difference.

During the making of the book, President Jimmy Carter heard about my project and wrote an exclusive letter to the children in the book. With your help, his message will reach children and empower them to work hard to reach their goals.

Thank you for your time and please help spread the word about our project.

Always Dream Big,

Matthew Jordan Smith

story:
Dear Friends, 

Social responsibility has always been a central topic for me, even when I was still unable to understand as well as articulate what that innate passion was. Up until now however, I have been able to concretely accomplish very little, there is much to do.

Since its creation, I have been following very closely a non- profit organization called “Accountability Lab”, founded by my dear and admired friend Blair Glencorse. Their simple yet powerful approach to addressing issues related to governance, youth empowerment to drive social change has caught my attention. 

So here I am, as one of the pilot Impact Investment Fellows of the Accountability Lab, going to Nepal to support the Lab's projects that help communities fight corruption, the root cause of poverty and suffering in many parts of the world.  

On September 12, I’m joining a group of people from around the world visiting the Accountability Lab’s work in Nepal to get hands-on insight on how things work and to encourage and mentor the Accountapreneurs. I am funding my own travel.  

And here is where I ask for your help...I need your donation to help me raise $3,000 to invest in the Lab's projects while I am in Nepal.  $3,000 will support three accountapreneurship projects for six months! Please donate what you can to help further this important cause, to provide these courageous change-makers with some the financial resources they need to continue the success of their work. And help us spread the word on social media!  

Every penny that we will raise will go to the projects and the Lab and I will monitor their use.  We will add our know-how into the mix to help the projects make the most of these limited funds! I will personally stay engaged as a mentor and continue to donate my time and efforts.  This will be a real investment, with the hope that the money will return back to the Accountability Lab for re-investment in future projects! You are also invited to join the program as fellow if you wish :)  Here is a little video that describes the program (also donated by Gokhan at Productive).  You can help courageous young people in Nepal by donating whatever you can.

A little bit on why I chose to fight corruption and Nepal, and why I chose the Accountability Lab as the right channel for my contribution.  Corruption costs $2.6 billion a year—more than 17 times what the world spends on international aid. It saps trust, undermines opportunity and perpetuates inequalities. It is at the root of poverty, exclusion and violence around the world. Nepal, in particular, suffers from a systemic corruption, and as the country recovers from over a decade of civil war and transitions to democracy, citizens need tools to hold their government accountable.  It's a small country where small efforts can lead to big impacts.

The Accountability Lab is an award-winning, non-profit organization that empowers citizens to build low-cost, high-impact tools for anti-corruption and accountability in some of the world’s most difficult places. The team provides training, mentorship, networks, management support and seed funding to local change-makers, or as we like to call them, “accountapreneurs” with creative ideas for change in their communities.  

These accountapreneurship projects include: an Accountability Film School to teach young Nepali how to make documentaries about issues in their community, a handbook for investigative journalists to use to overcome obstacles in obtaining information from the government, a program to integrate hands-on, practical civic education into school curriculum, an online platform to crowdsource information on how to navigate government services, and a TV show called Integrity Idol highlighting the country’s most honest civil servants. Together, these efforts form a vibrant, bottom-up movement for accountability that can have a lasting impact on the lives of people all over the country.

So please please donate what you can.  It will mean a lot not just for me but those who will be encouraged to do more with your contribution.  Thank you!

story:
Ottawa is a city on the road to greatness

Ottawa is coming into its own. The city is proudly geeky in both the tech and policy spheres, enthusiastically outdoorsy and loves a great meal and a good pint. Best of all, the city is becoming a place where people creating new art, technology or businesses can find a welcoming and supportive community to back up their efforts

Apt613’s goal is to fill what we see as one of the biggest challenges facing the emerging Ottawa cultural scene: the lack of media coverage on what’s going on in the city and the people making it happen. There’s a ton of events happening on a nightly basis – dance parties, burlesque shows, board game nights, art exhibits, neighborhood festivals – but without a local weekly to act as a clearinghouse for all these events, it can be hard to connect.


Over the last five years we’ve expanded Apt613 beyond the blog to include a radio show, a lecture series and our yearly Support Local Campaign. We’ve grown from a team of seven to over fifty volunteer editors, writers, photographers and radio producers. Now we’re hoping to take our coverage of the best of Ottawa’s grassroots arts and culture to the next level.

The Apt613 Fellowship Program will allow us to fund projects that go beyond blog posts and radio segments. The possibilities are endless. A web mini-series that goes behind the scenes of Ottawa’s restaurants. An in-depth series of articles on the local Aboriginal arts community. A Jon Stewart-type satire on municipal politics. A comic detailing dating life in the capital. A photo essay on local fashion designers. We will be looking for ideas that bring light to parts of Ottawa that aren’t getting the attention they deserve, or that use innovative and exciting formats to tell local stories.

Anyone from the Ottawa community will be able to apply for a fellowship; successful candidates will get monetary support as well as advice and other assistance from Apt613. $7,000 of our goal for this campaign will go directly to fund the fellowship projects, while the remaining $3,000 will help us offset our administration and website costs. Apt613 is a volunteer-driven and not-for-profit organization, and any money collected past our goal will go towards our administrative costs as well as our other initiatives.

Ottawa’s cultural scene is going places. Help us support this momentum.

Our perks!

All of our perks have been generously donated by some amazing Ottawa people: awesome authors, musicians, shops and businesses. Together we hope to continue building and supporting the Ottawa arts and culture scene we all enjoy.

Every donation will get a shout-out on Twitter and our Apt613 campaign page (unless you'd rather not! - just make a note of that in the comments section).

Most perks can be picked up at A Curious Shop in the Byward Market (159 York Street). The Book Lovers Plus will be ready for pick-up on April 22. The Virtual Hug Plus, Neighbourhood Map, Book Lovers, and Spins & Needles perks will be available as of May 10, 2014.

Virtual Hug Plus

You’ll get a shout-out and an exclusive Apt613 t-shirt, available in three designs.

Kichesippi Brewery Tour

Ever wonder how your local craft brewery makes it all happen? Take a tour with Sustainability Officer Chris Boerger as he shows you what makes them unique and shares samples of their latest brews. Oh, and you get a shout-out, too. The tour is happening May 10 @ 3:30 pm. The Kichesippi Brewery is located at 866 Campbell Avenue.


Exclusive Hilotrons Concert
Local indie pop band, The Hilotrons, will play an intimate hour-long show for 20 lucky music lovers. Claim this perk for one entry into the show. And we'll bring the snacks and Kichesippi beer along! The show is on May 27, 2014, doors at 7pm. Location to be revealed!


Support Local Prize Pack

We know you love this city as much as we do. Here's your chance to spread that lovin' feeling around. You'll get a Support Local t-shirt and poster designed by the one and only, Steve St. Pierre.


Neighbourhood Map of Ottawa-Gatineau

You’ll get a shout-out and an Alexandre Laquerre map of Ottawa-Gatineau neighbourhoods and landmarks, featuring the exact geographical limitations of your favourite hood. The poster is 24' x 36' and printed on high-quality silk finish paper.



Book Lovers

You get the usual shout-outs plus a mystery prize pack featuring 3 books by our city's finest authors.


Host Apt613 Live on CHUO FM

You get to take over the mic on APT613 Live, our weekly radio show on CHUO FM. This is your chance to interview your favourite Ottawa artists or musicians and decide which tunes to play. We are on Wednesdays from 9 - 10 pm. This perk can be booked anytime and we won't forget your shout-out.


Pick a Post

Do you ever wish we would write about your favourite restaurant, boutique or place to hang out? Now's your chance to influence, tell us! We'll work with you to schedule this post within six months from the end of the campaign.


Spins & Needles Prize Pack

You get a shout-out plus a Spins & Needles Ottawa Neighbourhoods prize pack, including a t-shirt and tote bag. Please specify in the comments box which t-shirt size you'd like (S, M, L, XL) and if it's a women's or men's shirt.

Shopping Party at Victoire

You and three friends will have a private shopping experience at Victoire with the owners Regine and Katie. You'll get wine, treats, 20% off all your purchases that night and a gift for each of you. Can be booked anytime. Shout-outs included!

A Day at Beau's
You and a friend get to spend the day at Beau's All Natural Brewing Company. Brew some beer, hang with the Beau's crew and take home a 12-pack of custom-labelled beer that you've botted! Beau's is located at 10 Terry Fox Drive in Vankleek Hill.


Your Personal Pop-Up Restaurant with NFA-Grub

Get a team of culinary talent to host your next gathering. The folks from NFA-Grub (hosts of the New Year's Day pop-up at Monopolatte) will design a menu with you to host a party of 8. They'll take their next pop-up to your kitchen! This perk includes food costs and labour. The location can be flexible and the date will be negotiated between the NFA-Grub crew and the donor.



Your Face on a Beau's Cap

That's right. You and everyone you know will  see your face printed on 100,000 Beau's bottle caps!

The poster is 24' x 36' and printed on high-quality silk finish paper.Book LoversYou get the usual shout-outs plus a mystery prize pack featuring 3 books by our city's finest authors.Host Apt613 Live on CHUO FMYou get to take over the mic on APT613 Live, our weekly radio show on CHUO FM. This is your chance to interview your favourite Ottawa artists or musicians and decide which tunes to play. We are on Wednesdays from 9 - 10 pm. This perk can be booked anytime and we won't forget your shout-out.Pick a PostDo you ever wish we would write about your favourite restaurant, boutique or place to hang out? Now's your chance to influence, tell us! We'll work with you to schedule this post within six months from the end of the campaign.Spins & Needles Prize PackYou get a shout-out plus a Spins & Needles Ottawa Neighbourhoods prize pack, including a t-shirt and tote bag. Please specify in the comments box which t-shirt size you'd like (S, M, L, XL) and if it's a women's or men's shirt.Shopping Party at VictoireYou and three friends will have a private shopping experience at Victoire with the owners Regine and Katie. You'll get wine, treats, 20% off all your purchases that night and a gift for each of you. Can be booked anytime. Shout-outs included!A Day at Beau'sYou and a friend get to spend the day at Beau's All Natural Brewing Company. Brew some beer, hang with the Beau's crew and take home a 12-pack of custom-labelled beer that you've botted! Beau's is located at 10 Terry Fox Drive in Vankleek Hill. Your Personal Pop-Up Restaurant with NFA-GrubGet a team of culinary talent to host your next gathering. The folks from NFA-Grub (hosts of the New Year's Day pop-up at Monopolatte) will design a menu with you to host a party of 8. They'll take their next pop-up to your kitchen! This perk includes food costs and labour. The location can be flexible and the date will be negotiated between the NFA-Grub crew and the donor.Your Face on a Beau's CapThat's right. You and everyone you know will  see your face printed on 100,000 Beau's bottle caps!

story:
Review

ACJ-YMCA is one of the most widespread voluntary organizations around the world, during 169 years has provided opportunities for spirit, mind and body growth and development, changing lives of thousands of children, young people and their families in Colombia and around the world. During 19 years, the ACJ-YMCA Santander has worked in the city of Bucaramanga and its metropolitan area, with the support of volunteers, dedicating his efforts to work primarily with children, young people and adults in a vulnerability situation, population in marginal sectors and victims of violence.

Our proposal is aimed at the attainment of funds for promotion and artistic and cultural formation of 100 kids and adolescents between 9 and 14 years old, living in vulnerable communities at high risk for the city; in order that they can participate in the formation of musical and dance groups that favor the exercise of their rights, the development of self-esteem and cultural identity.

With your support, we will achieve:

• Encourage creative use of children and adolescents free time

 •Create artistic groups of music, dance and theatre.

•Make visible the rights of the children and their participation in local development.

• Highlight the artistic expressions of children and adolescents.

•Buy musical instruments for the development of artistic education.

 •Support the artistic initiatives led by the children where they are the protagonists.

•Socialize the significant learning as a contribution to the building of peace in the region.

• Design of a primer that reflects the testimonies of children involved.

What we need

Our goal is to raise the sum of $ 20,000 which will be used for the payment of teachers, purchase of musical instruments for children and adolescents, transportation of young volunteers and the payment of the administrative services of the house where we hold the artistic workshops with their support.We appreciate the contribution of individuals and companies who decide to join and support our campaign. Since this way is linked to our Organization as partner and aid workers of the social actions of the organization volunteers and core members of the YMCA.

Those who are linked to our campaign will receive monthly newsletters, the progress of the actions; their impacts and the way of resources are invested. Your reward is the gratification of knowing that with your support, you contribute to the sponsorship of a child or adolescent that is formed through art to be a man of peace.

If we do not achieve the estimated goal of the campaign, the donated funds will be invested in the purchase of musical instruments and transportation of young volunteers to communities, to continue with the training.

Impact

Your contribution will make the difference!

With your contribution you are supporting children and their "well-being" determinant for the social development of our country; We need to create spaces to facilitate and hear the voice of children and adolescents, and thus generate more space and opportunities so that they develop their skills and personal, social and cognitive skills needed for healthy development; because it is necessary to stimulate decision-making, problem-solving, critical thinking, and assertive communication from early age, because requires the promotion of identity and rooting through cultural events, as a means for the mediation and prevention of the linkage of children to the conflict and armed groups; because our actions should be aimed at reducing high-risk situations to which the children are subjects girls; because need to promote "healthy" humans with habits that increase their self-esteem, assertive relations, confidence in themselves and in their environment, and empower them with leadership tools that stimulate their ability to contribute to the resolution of conflicts by peaceful means. Because when child or young guys play some musical instrument, sing, dance or make theatre their  world makes sense, stimulated his artistic perception and creative potential; Because the culture as a legacy able to transform society, to allow the rescue of cultural patterns giving sense to the tradition and our roots.

The campaign is very important since its articulates the construction of country from the development and recognition of children as actors in the social development, highlighting their cultural expressions, involving them in the defense of their rights of development, participation, protection and care towards the development of citizens for peace and coexistence behaviors, to strengthen its artistic expression from music, and dance. "Educate" children reduces poverty, as well as this proposal consists in teaching children and adolescents about their rights, talents, skills and means for carrying out their initiatives. Many of the families of the children come from rural areas and it is difficult to adapt to the adversities of the city obtaining the minimum conditions of housing, health and education recreation to those that are right. This entire problem is correlated with social inequality which expresses itself in large socio-economic differences and inequality in the possibilities of acquisition of resources, goods and services. 

 Our campaign focuses on funds for the promotion of the rights of children and adolescents between 9 and 14 years of age in communities at high risk for the city where the ACJ-YMCA develops social processes, in order to give continuity to the process already initiated and to involve new children in the training and musical initiation.

Our organization since 2008 develops this type of programs such as PAZo a PAZo: young people who dance and sing to peace, supported by the Culture Ministry,  through the program of Cultural consultation, where young people and children in the different venues of the city bring messages of peace, harmony and civic culture that are linked from dance, theatre, regional folklore and musical performance; along with the AFLATOUN social and financial education projects with children of lower-income and international de mobility programs. Music and dance promoting attitudes characteristic of culture of peace and coexistence, as social interactions healthy, stimulating and benefiting the expression of the individual; our campaign will allow youth expressions to be heard through lessons in groups and small concerts; In addition to their own individual lessons, motivating them to enjoy and grow through art. The development of the artistic activities fosters the development of the children and young people strengthen their creativity and their intellect, first in its practice groups, and then in their communities. On the other hand, become critics face social conflicts, since the art becomes a tool of expression and coping with the events that have affected their lives.

With your support you will contribute to the ACJ-YMCA Santander continue transforming lives, carrying traces of love, understanding and solidarity; to turn on lives of the children and young beneficiaries who live in difficult conditions and expect that people like you, to share so that they shine the light of hope. Ask people to spread your campaign and make sure to generate eco. Thank you for spreading our campaign, in this way, will be many people joining the initiative.

story:
We are members of Ricardy’s family.

On Friday march 7th 2014, we received “the phone call” that no one should ever receive for a member of their family, specially, the youngest one.

23 year old Ricardy, also known as Ricky, Rickbo…etc…, suffered a tragic and unimaginable death.

4 years prior Ricky survived a life-threatening shooting. After overcoming the possibility of being paralyzed along with death itself, Ricky was finally getting his life back together.  Overall, he wanted to fulfill his parents and brothers dreams and expectations of him while keeping his boys (“homies”) happy.  In the family, we know sometime we were tough on him because of the expectations and the examples he had to follow: “both of his older brothers got here in this country the same day that he did, both graduated from college with their Master’s degree in Accounting and Engineering respectively. Neither one has ever been in trouble.  People look at them as role models (success stories) for any family coming in this country”.  So, we understand the pressure that was on Ricky and we can tell sometime that bothered him a lot because he never received the proper credit for doing well in school or for trying to follow the right path.

After graduating from Palm Beach State College with an AA degree and an overall GPA of over 3.0, Ricky was accepted to both Florida State University (FSU) and Florida Atlantic University (FAU).  Ricky chooses FAU in order to follow his brothers’ footsteps.  Looking through his Facebook page the past few days, we realized how much impact his life had in the community especially for his friends.  To some, Ricky was a role model, a brother, a friend (loyal and compassionate), a student / classmate on his way to obtaining his master’s degree or PHD, if he wanted to please and impress his dad particularly, in Physical Therapy.  While on this journey to success, Ricky was repeatedly and brutally stabbed to death, a devastation that no one was prepared for.

We are now asking anyone who has been touched or impacted by Ricky’s life and death in one way or another to please lend us a helping hand in reaching our short term goal.

Our short term goal is raise $20,000 to help with funeral and burial expenses for Ricky. Together, we can finally send Ricky and his tired body home to rest in peace.

Long term we hope to establish a scholarship or some type of fund to help educate and fight violent crime in our community. These Stupidities and Non sense acts have to stop.  Look at how they are treating our community, our people, our kids (Haitians) as savages. As we mourning Ricky’s death, we will find a positive way to celebrate his short life on hearth and help many from suffering the same fate.  

What We Need & What You Get

For those who knew Ricky well, you all knew him for his flashy wardrobe and his exclusive sneakers: LeBron’s, Foams, polo’s etc. To show our gratitude for the donations and to share Ricky’s memories with you we are giving away at least 5 of his sneakers signed by the members of family to the 5 most generous Donors. We also are thinking about other memorabilia’s; for example: Gold or Silver necklaces, earing, dog tags with Ricky’s original fingerprint, t-shirts, hats… etc.) Please contact any member of the family for more information.

Other Ways You Can Help

Thank you all in advance for your Love, Prayers, Donations and Support. We greatly appreciate every little bit that you give, so keep supporting and spreading the word to help us reach our Goals.  Please tell your friends, family, coworkers, and neighbors. Let’s send Ricky home on the right note.

Forever, Rickbo Ricky Squeezy, We love you boi… R.I.P.

story:
Qui sommes-nous ?

Nous sommes un poste de huit pionniers de la 48eme (jeunes adultes de 16 à 18 ans) encadrés par deux animateurs adultes. Nous faisons partie du mouvement de jeunesse LES SCOUTS en Belgique. Comme chaque année, nous organisons un grand camp de juillet sous l'égide d'un projet d'entraide et de solidarité.

Cette année nous avons opté pour un projet humanitaire destiné aux enfants gravement malades.

D'une part, nous voyagerons à travers cinq pays d'Europe où nous consacrerons notre temps à l'animation et l'aide aux enfants dans le besoin ainsi qu'aux associations sociales locales.

D'autre part, nous lançons cette page de financement participatif dans l'espoir de venir en aide financièrement à Kelly, une petite fille atteinte d'une maladie grave en Belgique. Nous lançons cette démarche en partenariat avec MAKE A WISH-BELGIUM South qui s'occupe de réaliser les voeux des enfants malades.

Durant tout notre voyage n'hésitez pas à nous suivre sur TWITTER, INSTAGRAM et FACEBOOK. Vous y découvrirez nos activités, nos rencontres, nos échanges...

Notre voyage sera notre moyen de nous engager tangiblement pour aider ceux qui en ont besoin. C'est notre manière d'être crédible face à ceux qui souhaiteraient nous aider à financer le voeu de Kelly.

Pourquoi un projet de grand camp ?

Faire partie d'un mouvement comme le scoutisme, c'est s'engager à défendre des valeurs et une vision du monde. Au sein d'une unité scoute, nous tentons de vivre sous l'égide de la confiance, de la solidarité et de l'écoute des uns et des autres.

Décider d'opter pour un projet de camp demande une réflexion qui puisse allier nos convictions collectives, nos ambitions, notre intégrité personnelle et notre identité de groupe.

En tant qu'animateur pionnier, j'ai toujours été légèrement en colère envers ces projets de camp qui ne respectaient aucune valeur de groupe mais répondaient « simplement » au besoin de légitimé d'un voyage de fin d'année. Reconstruire un château qui tombe en ruine dans le sud de la France, par exemple, est d'une aide précieuse pour le patrimoine national d'un pays et permet au poste pionnier de faire partie d'un acte de solidarité. Ce type de projet répond pleinement aux « conditions » qui font que nous faisons partie d'un mouvement de jeunesse ; mais en quoi cela est-il légitime et cohérent avec l'identité même du groupe si aucun des jeunes et aucun des animateurs ne se sent concerné par les châteaux, le patrimoine architectural, l'entreprenariat ?

Il était donc important pour nous de pouvoir répondre aussi bien à notre engagement scout qu'à nos valeurs personnelles et collectives, nous plaçant au centre de nos convictions les plus intimes. Rien de mieux, il me semble, pour se sentir stimulé et cohérent.

Les raisons de notre projet ?

Très vite, nous avons compris vouloir nous créer un projet de camp qui puisse représenter au mieux notre génération ainsi que l’essence même du scoutisme : l'animation et l'engagement. D'autant plus quand la majorité des pionniers souhaitent devenir animateurs.

D'une part, nous voulons apporter un bienfait réel et tangible à la société ; nous placer au plus proche de l'humain et de ses enjeux. D'autre part, nous souhaitons pouvoir profiter des moyens de communication instantanée contemporains comme les réseaux sociaux (Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Pinterest) afin de communiquer au plus grand nombre instantanément de manière intelligente en réponse au constant suivant : nous avons été bercés et nous avons grandi avec la télé-réalité ou la compétition et les nominations déterminent les rapports relationnels. Nous avons pu parfois devenir « accros » à certaines émissions et cela ne nous aura pas rendus plus intelligents. Aujourd'hui notre volonté est de tenter d'en tirer les bienfaits et de profiter de cette pratique qui consiste à s'afficher face au monde pour communiquer un message, une action positive et engageante.

Notre projet de grand camp ?

Nous avons décidé de voyager à travers l'Europe en train. Notre engagement humanitaire se fera auprès des enfants en difficultés. Notre ambition, en partenariat avec l’association MAKE A WISH – BELGIQUE South, est de pouvoir s'engager en tant que scouts et citoyens avertis des enjeux humains. L'animation pour les enfants en difficulté sera notre manière de physiquement et tangiblement s'engager. De plus, nous avons décidé de nous inscrire dans un projet social plus vaste et financer le voeu d'un enfant malade belge. L'idée est donc celle d'un camp parrainé (au même titre qu'une marche parrainée) pour récolter de l'argent en faisant appel à la solidarité mondiale.

Où allons-nous ?

Nous voyagerons à travers la SLOVENIE, la HONGRIE, la SLOVAQUIE et la REPUBLIQUE TCHEQUE.



A LJUBLJANA: Nous irons animer et soutenir un camp de vacances  pour enfants atteint de maladies cérébrales.

MARIBOR: Nous irons animer et soutenir des enfants handicapés physiques. 



BUDAPEST : Nous irons animer et soutenir une association à BUDAPEST s'occupant d'enfant aveugles et malvoyants.



BRATISLAVA : Nous irons animer et soutenir une association à BRATISLAVA s'occupant d'enfants victimes de problèmes moteurs.



PRAGUE: Nous irons animer et soutenir une association à PRAGUE s'occupant d'enfant durant les congés scolaires. 

MAKE A WISH ?

Peuplée de rêves, l'enfance est le monde de tous les possibles : devenir pompier l'espace d'une journée, parcourir le monde à la découverte des dauphins, vivre la vie d'une star, rencontrer son idole ...

Mais lorsque la maladie frappe, l'enfance bascule, l'équilibre familial vacille et le bonheur s'estompe. Séjours à l'hôpital, examens médicaux et traitements font alors partie du quotidien.

Malgré la maladie, les rêves continuent d'habiter le coeur des enfants. Ces rêves, Make-A-Wish® Belgium South a pour mission qu'ils deviennent réalité.

Pour l'enfant malade, la réalisation d'un voeu est un moment magique à double titre. Tout d'abord, parce qu'il va vivre son rêve, bien sûr, mais également parce qu'il va le partager avec sa famille et ses amis.

Make-A-Wish® Belgium South donne en effet l'occasion à l'enfant d'être à l'origine de moments positifs qu'il partage avec ses proches. Ces moments continuent à vivre dans le coeur des enfants.

Pour eux, toutes les étincelles d'espoir ou de bonheur sont autant de soutien pour affronter le quotidien, d'énergies positives pour aider à une guérison.

Pour ces bonnes raisons, les bénévoles, les parrains et les donateurs de Make-A-Wish® Belgium South mettent tout en oeuvre pour exaucer ces voeux. Nous voudrions faire plus, faire mieux...

Et pour cela, nous avons besoin de vous, d'un peu de votre temps, de votre soutien financier, de votre réseau de connaissances ...

Le voeu de Kelly ?

Kelly est une petit fille atteinte d'une maladie grave. Elle aimerait pouvoir rencontrer son idole : Kevin DE BRUYNE.

Pour ceux qui ne le connaitraient pas, Kevin DE BRUYNE est le numéro 7 de l'équipe nationale belge.


En BELGIQUE, les DIABLES ROUGES sont un véritable phénomène sportif, social et politique. Leur belle campagne en coupe du monde de football n'a que confirmé tout le bien que le pays pensait déjà d'eux. Symboliquement, les DIABLES ROUGES réussissent ce que le gouvernement belge tente depuis plusieurs années : unir le pays et les différentes communautés.

Il était important pour nous de choisir et de soutenir un voeu qui puisse être en lien avec notre génération et avec notre projet. Aider une petite fille à rencontrer son idole suffit à légitimer notre engagement. Mais celui-ci est encore plus juste quand il englobe des valeurs de solidarité, de fraternité et d'union comme le fait l'enseigne des DIABLES ROUGES.

A quoi servira votre argent ?

Quand un enfant est soutenu par MAKE A WISH Belgium South, le voeu englobe toute une série de frais.

  • Un voeu n'est jamais celui d'un seul enfant mais celui de toute sa famille. MAKE A WISH Belgium South permet à l'enfant de vivre son rêve entouré de ses parents, de ses frères et de ses soeurs...

  • Lors d'une rencontre avec une star comme Kevin DE BRUYNE, MAKE A WISH Belgium South offre toute la panoplie d'accessoires permettant à l'enfant de garder des souvenirs tangibles. Comme le maillot de foot, la casquette...

  • Pour tous les voeux ,MAKE A WISH Belgium South engage une assurance extrêmement détaillée.

  • Pour que le voeu de Kelly se passe dans les meilleurs conditions, MAKE A WISH Belgium South organise une mise en scène et un événement marquant afin de sacraliser la rencontre avec Kevin DE BRUYNE. Il s'agira probablement d'un match de l'équipe nationale belge ou du club de Kevin DE BRUYNE (WOLSBURG en ALLEMAGNE) et d'un diner au restaurant.

  • Bien sur, il va de soit que les frais de déplacement sont assez couteux dans la mesure où MAKE A WISH Belgium South assure un confort irréprochable pour Kelly.

Nos motivations :

Voyager fait partie des grands souhaits d'un poste pionnier. A la recherche de nouvelles rencontres, de nouvelles cultures, de nouveaux paysages... Voyager en groupe entre amis est d'autant plus gratifiant et exaltant.

Notre volonté de vivre un projet de camp comme celui-là s'inscrit aussi dans le désir de formation des pionniers, c'est-à-dire dans leur envie de devenir animateurs. Des animateurs avertis et désireux d'expériences hors du commun. Nous avons conscience que le public que nous visiterons durant notre camp sera un public défavorisé nous renvoyant en partie à une forme d'impuissance. Cependant, c'est peut-être aussi de cette manière-là que nous pouvons nous rendre les plus utiles.

Le groupe se montre très ouvert et très motivé à l'idée de se confronter à une autre réalité, à une réalité issue d'une autre culture et d'une langue différente. Opter pour ce genre de projet représente pour nous le meilleur moyen de devenir de meilleurs êtres humains.

La communication de masse à-travers les réseaux sociaux est aussi l'un de nos objectifs : utiliser à bon escient la technologie pour une « noble » cause.

Comment nous suivre au jour le jour ?


INSTAGRAM : Pionnier.48e

TWITTER : @Pionnier48e

FACEBOOK : projetpionnier48e

YOUTUBE : Pionnier Impeesa

GMAIL : Pionnier.48e@gmail.com

LIENS :

http://www.lesscouts.be

http://www.la48eme.net

http://www.makeawishsud.be//#concert
story_txt:
Qui
sommes-nous ?




Nous
sommes un poste de huit pionniers de la 48eme (jeunes adultes de 16 à
18 ans) encadrés par deux animateurs adultes. Nous faisons partie du
mouvement de jeunesse LES SCOUTS en Belgique. Comme chaque année,
nous organisons un grand camp de juillet sous l'égide d'un projet
d'entraide et de solidarité.


Cette
année nous avons opté pour un projet humanitaire destiné aux
enfants gravement malades. 


D'une
part, nous voyagerons à travers cinq pays d'Europe où nous
consacrerons notre temps à l'animation et l'aide aux enfants dans le
besoin ainsi qu'aux associations sociales locales. 


D'autre
part, nous lançons cette page de financement participatif dans
l'espoir de venir en aide financièrement à Kelly, une petite fille
atteinte d'une maladie grave en Belgique. Nous lançons cette
démarche en partenariat avec MAKE A WISH-BELGIUM South qui s'occupe de
réaliser les voeux des enfants malades. 



Durant
tout notre voyage n'hésitez pas à nous suivre sur TWITTER,
INSTAGRAM et FACEBOOK. Vous y découvrirez nos activités, nos
rencontres, nos échanges... 



Notre
voyage sera notre moyen de nous engager tangiblement pour aider ceux
qui en ont besoin. C'est notre manière d'être crédible face à
ceux qui souhaiteraient nous aider à financer le voeu de Kelly. 



Pourquoi
un projet de grand camp ?


Faire
partie d'un mouvement comme le scoutisme, c'est s'engager à défendre
des valeurs et une vision du monde. Au sein d'une unité scoute, nous
tentons de vivre sous l'égide de la confiance, de la solidarité et
de l'écoute des uns et des autres. 


Décider
d'opter pour un projet de camp demande une réflexion qui puisse
allier nos convictions collectives, nos ambitions, notre intégrité
personnelle et notre identité de groupe. 



En
tant qu'animateur pionnier, j'ai toujours été légèrement en
colère envers ces projets de camp qui ne respectaient aucune valeur
de groupe mais répondaient « simplement » au besoin de
légitimé d'un voyage de fin d'année. Reconstruire un château qui
tombe en ruine dans le sud de la France, par exemple, est d'une aide
précieuse pour le patrimoine national d'un pays et permet au poste
pionnier de faire partie d'un acte de solidarité. Ce type de projet
répond pleinement aux « conditions » qui font que nous
faisons partie d'un mouvement de jeunesse ; mais en quoi cela
est-il légitime et cohérent avec l'identité même du groupe si
aucun des jeunes et aucun des animateurs ne se sent concerné par les
châteaux, le patrimoine architectural, l'entreprenariat ?


Il
était donc important pour nous de pouvoir répondre aussi bien à
notre engagement scout qu'à nos valeurs personnelles et collectives,
nous plaçant au centre de nos convictions les plus intimes. Rien de
mieux, il me semble, pour se sentir stimulé et cohérent. 



Les
raisons de notre projet ?


Très
vite, nous avons compris vouloir nous créer un projet de camp qui
puisse représenter au mieux notre génération ainsi que l’essence
même du scoutisme : l'animation et l'engagement. D'autant plus
quand la majorité des pionniers souhaitent devenir animateurs.


D'une
part, nous voulons apporter un bienfait réel et tangible à la
société ; nous placer au plus proche de l'humain et de ses
enjeux. D'autre part, nous souhaitons pouvoir profiter des moyens de
communication instantanée contemporains comme les réseaux sociaux
(Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Pinterest) afin de communiquer au plus
grand nombre instantanément de manière intelligente en réponse au
constant suivant :  nous avons été bercés et nous avons
grandi avec la télé-réalité ou la compétition et les nominations
déterminent les rapports relationnels. Nous avons pu parfois devenir
« accros » à certaines émissions et cela ne nous aura
pas rendus plus intelligents. Aujourd'hui notre volonté est de
tenter d'en tirer les bienfaits et de profiter de cette pratique qui
consiste à s'afficher face au monde pour communiquer un message, une
action positive et engageante. 



Notre
projet de grand camp ?


Nous
avons décidé de voyager à travers l'Europe en train. Notre
engagement humanitaire se fera auprès des enfants en difficultés.
Notre ambition, en partenariat avec l’association MAKE A WISH –
BELGIQUE South, est de pouvoir s'engager en tant que scouts et citoyens
avertis des enjeux humains. L'animation pour les enfants en
difficulté sera notre manière de physiquement et tangiblement
s'engager. De plus, nous avons décidé de nous inscrire dans un
projet social plus vaste et financer le voeu d'un enfant malade
belge. L'idée est donc celle d'un camp parrainé (au même titre
qu'une marche parrainée) pour récolter de l'argent en faisant appel
à la solidarité mondiale.


Où
allons-nous ?


Nous
voyagerons à travers la SLOVENIE, la HONGRIE, la SLOVAQUIE et la
REPUBLIQUE TCHEQUE.


A LJUBLJANA: 	Nous irons animer et soutenir un camp de vacances  pour 			enfants atteint de maladies cérébrales.MARIBOR: Nous irons animer et soutenir des enfants handicapés physiques. 

BUDAPEST :	Nous irons animer et soutenir une association à
BUDAPEST s'occupant 				d'enfant aveugles et malvoyants.

BRATISLAVA :	Nous irons animer et soutenir une association à
BRATISLAVA s'occupant 				d'enfants victimes de problèmes moteurs.PRAGUE: Nous irons animer et soutenir une association à PRAGUE s'occupant d'enfant durant les congés scolaires. 



MAKE
A WISH ?

Peuplée
de rêves, l'enfance est le monde de tous les possibles : devenir
pompier l'espace d'une journée, parcourir le monde à la découverte
des dauphins, vivre la vie d'une star, rencontrer son idole ...


Mais
lorsque la maladie frappe, l'enfance bascule, l'équilibre familial
vacille et le bonheur s'estompe. Séjours à l'hôpital, examens
médicaux et traitements font alors partie du quotidien.

Malgré
la maladie, les rêves continuent d'habiter le coeur des enfants. Ces
rêves, Make-A-Wish® Belgium South a pour mission qu'ils deviennent
réalité.


Pour
l'enfant malade, la réalisation d'un voeu est un moment magique à
double titre. Tout d'abord, parce qu'il va vivre son rêve, bien sûr,
mais également parce qu'il va le partager avec sa famille et ses
amis.


Make-A-Wish® Belgium
South donne en effet l'occasion à l'enfant d'être à l'origine de
moments positifs qu'il partage avec ses proches. Ces moments
continuent à vivre dans le coeur des enfants. 


Pour
eux, toutes les étincelles d'espoir ou de bonheur sont autant de
soutien pour affronter le quotidien, d'énergies positives pour aider
à une guérison.


Pour
ces bonnes raisons, les bénévoles, les parrains et les donateurs de
Make-A-Wish® Belgium South mettent tout en oeuvre pour exaucer
ces voeux. Nous voudrions faire plus, faire mieux...

Et
pour cela, nous avons besoin de vous, d'un peu de votre temps, de
votre soutien financier, de votre réseau de connaissances ...


Le
voeu de Kelly ?


Kelly
est une petit fille atteinte d'une maladie grave. Elle aimerait
pouvoir rencontrer son idole : Kevin DE BRUYNE. 


Pour
ceux qui ne le connaitraient pas,  Kevin DE BRUYNE est le numéro 7
de l'équipe nationale belge. 




En
BELGIQUE, les DIABLES ROUGES sont un véritable phénomène sportif,
social et politique. Leur belle campagne en coupe du monde de
football n'a que confirmé tout le bien que le pays pensait déjà
d'eux. Symboliquement, les DIABLES ROUGES réussissent ce que le
gouvernement belge tente depuis plusieurs années : unir le pays
et les différentes communautés. 



Il
était important pour nous de choisir et de soutenir un voeu qui
puisse être en lien avec notre génération et avec notre projet.
Aider une petite fille à rencontrer son idole suffit à légitimer
notre engagement. Mais celui-ci est encore plus juste quand il
englobe des valeurs de solidarité, de fraternité et d'union comme
le fait l'enseigne des DIABLES ROUGES. 



A
quoi servira votre argent ?


Quand
un enfant est soutenu par MAKE A WISH Belgium South, le voeu englobe toute une
série de frais. 





	Un
	voeu n'est jamais celui d'un seul enfant mais celui de toute sa
	famille. MAKE A WISH Belgium South permet à l'enfant de vivre son rêve entouré
	de ses parents, de ses frères et de ses soeurs...



	Lors
	d'une rencontre avec une star comme  Kevin DE BRUYNE, MAKE A WISH
Belgium South	offre toute la panoplie d'accessoires permettant à l'enfant de
	garder des souvenirs tangibles. Comme le maillot de foot, la
	casquette... 
	



	Pour
	tous les voeux ,MAKE A WISH Belgium South engage une assurance extrêmement
	détaillée.



	Pour
	que le voeu de Kelly se passe dans les meilleurs conditions, MAKE A
	WISH Belgium South organise une mise en scène et un événement marquant afin de
	sacraliser la rencontre avec  Kevin DE BRUYNE. Il s'agira
	probablement d'un match de l'équipe nationale belge
	ou du club de Kevin DE BRUYNE (WOLSBURG en ALLEMAGNE) et d'un diner
	au restaurant. 
	



	Bien
	sur, il va de soit que les frais de déplacement sont assez couteux
	dans la mesure où MAKE A WISH Belgium South assure un confort irréprochable pour
	Kelly.  
	


Nos
motivations :


Voyager
fait partie des grands souhaits d'un poste pionnier. A la recherche
de nouvelles rencontres, de nouvelles cultures, de nouveaux
paysages... Voyager en groupe entre amis est d'autant plus gratifiant
et exaltant. 


Notre
volonté de vivre un projet de camp comme celui-là s'inscrit aussi
dans le désir de formation des pionniers, c'est-à-dire dans leur
envie de devenir animateurs. Des animateurs avertis et désireux
d'expériences hors du commun. Nous avons conscience que le public
que nous visiterons durant notre camp sera un public défavorisé
nous renvoyant en partie à une forme d'impuissance. Cependant, c'est
peut-être aussi de cette manière-là que nous pouvons nous rendre
les plus utiles. 



Le
groupe se montre très ouvert et très motivé à l'idée de se
confronter à une autre réalité, à une réalité issue d'une autre
culture et d'une langue différente. Opter pour ce genre de projet
représente pour nous le meilleur moyen de devenir de meilleurs êtres
humains. 



La
communication de masse à-travers les réseaux sociaux est aussi l'un
de nos objectifs : utiliser à bon escient la technologie pour
une « noble » cause. 




Comment
nous suivre au jour le jour ?
INSTAGRAM : Pionnier.48e
TWITTER :
		@Pionnier48e


FACEBOOK :
projetpionnier48eYOUTUBE :
		Pionnier
Impeesa

		Pionnier.48e@gmail.com

story:
Short Summary

A group of friends very close to Brandon Kramm decided to organize a memorial golf tournament.  Quickly realizing that there was strong interest, it would not be possible to accept every team into the tournament.  The goal of this tournament is to raise money for the Brandon Kramm Memorial Scholarship Fund. We wanted to provide several options for donating, and this is one of them.

A Little About the Cause

The proceeds of this campaign will be going to the Brandon Kramm Memorial Scholarship Fund at Lewisburg High School. Brandon Kramm was a 2001 graduate of Lewisburg High School and a 2005 graduate of Harvard with a degree in Economics. He was a leader, honor student, a great athlete and role model for others. Daily he demonstrated qualities of honesty, integrity, loyalty and selflessness. Brandon enjoyed life and led by example. His generous heart, disciplined work ethic and constant smile are something we can all aspire to achieve. He forged ahead with grace and dignity through extremely difficult and painful times in his illness and never gave up hope for a full recovery. These are the qualities we look for in an LHS student to receive this scholarship; the recipient of this award must maintain at least a 3.5 GPA and letter in at least one sport at LHS.  He or she must attend a 4 yr college.

Other Ways You Can Help

Along with this fundraising campaign we are soliciting persons and businesses to become sponsors to our golf tournament to pay for things such as food, drink, and other costs that are associated with organizing an event.  For more info contact us at kramm.golf.info@gmail.com

story:
Short Summary

As a now 30 year old, I've seen some ups and downs in my life. I have overcome many obstacles including losing a child. It was actually that devastating loss that helped prompt me to go back to school. I needed to better myself and I desperately wanted a way to help others who have seen hardship. now that i have my AA, I have been accepted to a few schools, in the San Fransisco area. this means I need to make a move, which unfortunately I am financial unprepared for. Working only 2 days a week, has left me with a very large financial hurdle that i need your help to overcome.

I would love to be able to make the move, and further my education. I ideally need to come up with 4000 to cover the move and my uncovered portion of tuition. If I can pull this together and meet my goal it puts me one step closer to my ultimate goal of a career in social work. One big step closer to being able to help others in dire need.


What I Need & What You Get

What I need is roughly 4000 to move and cover tuition fees, as well as books in my first year at a 4 year university.I see that as a somewhat unrealistic goal, so I've set the goal lower. However it can never hurt to be optiistic and hope for the best. Every penny counts, and it all goes stright to helping me get to college, and start on my next degree. I've been accepted at CSUEB and it would mean the world to me if I could actually go. I don't have much to give in return for any received donations, except my eternal gratitude. I can offer to make custom jewelry or other craft projects in return for donations as well. I know its not much, but I would like to be able to give back to those who help my cause.

The Impact

The impact your donation has, is major. You help me go to College, as a first generation college student. You help a woman further her education, and overcome a financial hardship. You help to make the lives of those less fortunate better, by creating an opportunity for educational success. Most importantly though, you help impact the lives of future children and adults who need the help of people who care, through social work.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

Simply sharing this, gets my cause out there, and that helps!
