story:
Our Heart

We (the Castrillo kids) have been invited to participate in a mission outreach to Jamaica this summer with Global Passion Ministries. For Celina and Isaac Castrillo it will be their first mission trip they have attended. For Lea it will be her third and for me (Abby) it will be my final Remain Student Ministries mission trip. Mission trips have been embedded into the DNA of us. We believe this is a God opportunity to be able to go together for the first time and for the final time as a family in our youth group. We will be doing different types of outreaches and various types of servitude in Jamaica. God's heart is for the widows and the orphans, and that is the heart we intend to share to the people of Jamaica.

The Need and The Reward

For us to be able to step foot in Jamaica we must first raise the money to get there. We are asking you to consider making a one-time donation. Your financial contribution, whatever it may be, will allow God to touch the lives of those who don’t know the name of Jesus through us. You are not only investing in a mission trip but you are also investing in an experience with God's heart that is very present in the mission field. The trip costs $1850 per individual, so it will cost $7400 for the four of us. Yikes that's a lot of money, but I know God can work miracles and that anything is possible. We have created different types of perks for any donation so you would feel our gratefulness. Any amount counts and we are grateful. Whatever money is raised we will put it towards our Jamaica trip.

*Food will arrive before the photos and thank you notes arrive, once we receive the orders.

The Impact

Each day we will work assisting a local church in reaching their city with God’s love. We will be involved in dramas, evangelism, cultural programs, street rallies, children’s ministry and construction.

Here is the impact that your donations can bring:

  • We will be aiding in fixing parts of the orphanage we will be staying at.
  • We will be involved in various forms of construction.
  • We will be spending time with children that are motherless and fatherless.
  • We will be conducting various services to reach people for Jesus. 
  • You are investing in the hearts of the Jamaicans we will encounter.
  • You are investing in our experience to gain a heart for the orphans and widows that God has for them. 

Spreading the Word

We understand that people can't contribute financially but there are more ways to contribute then just financially. 

  1. Get the word out! You can use word of mouth to spread this page to others so others can contribute and share.
  2. Use the Indiegogo share tools to share this website
  3. Please share even if you do donate!

story:
My name is Olga Dobrowolska and I have been chosen to attend a 2 year professional program at Peridance Capezio Center in NY.

I am a 20 year old dancer and law student coming from a small town in Poland. Eight months ago, after the first year of university, I took a deans leave to go for a dream trip to the USA where I would give myself the chance to see how far I can go by focusing on dancing only. For six months my dance trip took me to Minnesota, Los Angeles and New York City. It was full of positive feedback from the best choreographers and various performances with my idols in the dance industry convinced me that dancing, choreographing and directing is what I am truly meant to do in this life. Two days before my flight back to Poland I auditioned for the professional dance program at Peridance Capezio Center. After competing with numerous amazing dancers, I was accepted into the program and got this once in a lifetime opportunity to actually live my dream!

 

Why is this a life changing opportunity for me?


I grew up in a small town with about 50 000 citizens where I didn't have a chance to profit from professional dance training. Everything I have learned and achieved in dance was mostly the result of attending international workshops all around Poland and working by myself in my hometown. Now I'm standing in front of great opportunity to add a serious, professional dance education to my passion, creativity and my skills, which will put me on a whole different level and will finally open the doors for a professional career in dance.

 

Why Peridance and NYC?

Due to the almost missing dance industry in Poland there is no serious possibility to study dance as a mojor subject. The USA represent a remarkable dance industry which is much bigger than the one in Europe. Having an all American technical training is regarded as a brand in Europe and guarantees a very high level of education in dance. While being in New York for the three months I met lots of people who appreciated my work and who could understand me as a dancer. Having my individual style and a respectable work ethic convinced people to approach me in order to cooperate with me or invite me to join their projects.
 

 

The Peridance Capezio Centre offers a truly attractive and intense program for dancers with determination to become professionals. In two years of training five days a week, attending seminars and workshops and also creating showcases that are worth of conquering international stages, Peridance offers everything and even more than a dancer could wish for.

 

“The Certificate Program's objectives are to provide a deep understanding of proper dance technique and performance expression, to foster extensive knowledge of the chosen dance track, and to develop a professional attitude. Performance skills are honed through numerous performance opportunities, seminars, and workshops.

The program offers two tracks: Ballet/Contemporary and Commercial. The curriculum offers a minimum of three classes per day, five days a week for each track. The program emphasizes personal attention and mentoring in order to nurture each student's full potential as a performer and an individual. Technique classes are drawn from course offerings designed especially for the Certificate Program to provide specialized experiences for the pre-professional student, and also from Peridance's open class offerings, which allow the dancers to train alongside New York City and international professional dancers in a dynamic environment.

To facilitate their transformation into well-rounded dance professionals, students attend technique classes in varying dance styles relevant to their chosen track and non-studio classes and seminars that flesh out their education and knowledge of the field. Students receive letter grades in all technique and non-studio classes, as well as in Workshops, Performance Analyses, and Independent Study Projects.” [www.peridance.com]

 

 

 

The cost

The Polish education system provides free studying for its best individuals. However studying without a scolarship like that is possible by simply paying a fee which equals less than a fifth of a regular studying fee in the USA. My parents did not expect me to study in the US, and my great academic results and achievements assured them that financial precautions for education were unneccesary. Moreover, having two studying sibilings in different cities unfortunately means that this once in a lifetime opportunity cannot be fully founded by my parents at any rate.


The school requires a fee of 10 800 $ per year (the goal is 11 700 $ cause fo fee for indie gogo). With the help of my friends and family we'll try to handle living costs. By getting enough money to pay one year of the school, there would be a possibility to gain a scholarship for the second year. Its very important to me to prove to my parents that I am capable of receiving a scholarship for my own education in dance as I was able in law. I believe that  this also would finally make them understand how important it is to me to follow the career that matches my personal legend.

 

Please remember that your donation will let me experience a world of dance, that seemed to be unreachable for almost all my life. It will also make me a better artist and give me the opportunity to contribute creativity, joy and passion to the world of dance. Simply put it helps to keep dance, as the probably most beautiful art form known by the human race alive.

 

At some point in our lives there comes a moment that erases all doubts and fears and shows us that whatever it is we want to do is right. Absolutely right and nothing else. This is my moment. This is my chance. And you are the one who can make this happen!

 

I am incredibly grateful for any kind of support. It doesn't matter whether its sharing the idea on the internet or telling your friends about it at school, work or gym. It might be a donation, kind words or simply the attention you payed to this project. Thank you very much!
story_txt:
My name is Olga Dobrowolska and I have been chosen to attend a 2 year professional program at Peridance Capezio Center in NY.
I am a 20 year old dancer and law student coming from a small town in Poland. Eight months ago, after the first year of university, I took a deans leave to go for a dream trip to the USA where I would give myself the chance to see how far I can go by focusing on dancing only. For six months my dance trip took me to Minnesota, Los Angeles and New York City. It was full of positive feedback from the best choreographers and various performances with my idols in the dance industry convinced me that dancing, choreographing and directing is what I am truly meant to do in this life. Two days before my flight back to Poland I auditioned for the professional dance program at Peridance Capezio Center. After competing with numerous amazing dancers, I was accepted into the program and got this once in a lifetime opportunity to actually live my dream!
 
Why is this a life changing opportunity for me?
I grew up in a small town with about 50 000 citizens where I didn't have a chance to profit from professional dance training. Everything I have learned and achieved in dance was mostly the result of attending international workshops all around Poland and working by myself in my hometown. Now I'm standing in front of great opportunity to add a serious, professional dance education to my passion, creativity and my skills, which will put me on a whole different level and will finally open the doors for a professional career in dance. 
 
Why Peridance and NYC?
Due to the almost missing dance industry in Poland there is no serious possibility to study dance as a mojor subject. The USA represent a remarkable dance industry which is much bigger than the one in Europe. Having an all American technical training is regarded as a brand in Europe and guarantees a very high level of education in dance. While being in New York for the three months I met lots of people who appreciated my work and who could understand me as a dancer. Having my individual style and a respectable work ethic convinced people to approach me in order to cooperate with me or invite me to join their projects.  
 
The Peridance Capezio Centre offers a truly attractive and intense program for dancers with determination to become professionals. In two years of training five days a week, attending seminars and workshops and also creating showcases that are worth of conquering international stages, Peridance offers everything and even more than a dancer could wish for.
 
“The Certificate Program's objectives are to provide a deep understanding of proper dance technique and performance expression, to foster extensive knowledge of the chosen dance track, and to develop a professional attitude. Performance skills are honed through numerous performance opportunities, seminars, and workshops.
The program offers two tracks: Ballet/Contemporary and Commercial. The curriculum offers a minimum of three classes per day, five days a week for each track. Technique classes are drawn from course offerings designed especially for the Certificate Program to provide specialized experiences for the pre-professional student, and also from Peridance's open class offerings, which allow the dancers to train alongside New York City and international professional dancers in a dynamic environment.
To facilitate their transformation into well-rounded dance professionals, students attend technique classes in varying dance styles relevant to their chosen track and non-studio classes and seminars that flesh out their education and knowledge of the field. Students receive letter grades in all technique and non-studio classes, as well as in Workshops, Performance Analyses, and Independent Study Projects.” [www.peridance.com]

However studying without a scolarship like that is possible by simply paying a fee which equals less than a fifth of a regular studying fee in the USA. My parents did not expect me to study in the US, and my great academic results and achievements assured them that financial precautions for education were unneccesary. Moreover, having two studying sibilings in different cities unfortunately means that this once in a lifetime opportunity cannot be fully founded by my parents at any rate.
 The school requires a fee of 10 800 $ per year (the goal is 11 700 $ cause fo fee for indie gogo). With the help of my friends and family we'll try to handle living costs. By getting enough money to pay one year of the school, there would be a possibility to gain a scholarship for the second year. Its very important to me to prove to my parents that I am capable of receiving a scholarship for my own education in dance as I was able in law. I believe that  this also would finally make them understand how important it is to me to follow the career that matches my personal legend.
 
Please remember that your donation will let me experience a world of dance, that seemed to be unreachable for almost all my life. It will also make me a better artist and give me the opportunity to contribute creativity, joy and passion to the world of dance. Simply put it helps to keep dance, as the probably most beautiful art form known by the human race alive.

story:
Ríos to Rivers: Supporting Healthy Rivers and Positive Growth for Young Chilean Kayakers

(¡Versión en Español abajo!)

Ríos to Rivers was founded by river runners from the Colorado River basin who have grown up with the legacy of the United States’ golden era of dam building.

We’ve teamed up with Club Náutico Escualo, a youth kayaking club from Chilean Patagonia that teaches confidence and self-respect, and fosters a deep connection with local rivers and wilderness. Club Náutico Escualo's home river, the pristine Río Baker, and the nearby Río Pascua are threatened by five mega-dams, similar to those on the Colorado River. 

Club Náutico Escualo, a free youth kayak club that has been teaching kayaking on the remote Rio Baker for the last 14 years. Photo: Claudia Altamirano

Time is short, but there’s still a chance to stop the dams. The transmission line needed to deliver the power 2,000 kilometers to Santiago, Chile, hasn’t been approved. 74% of Chileans oppose the dams and the lines.

Club Náutico Escualo paddling on the endangered Rio Baker. Photo Weston Boyles

In August 2013, Ríos to Rivers will lead eight members of Club Náutico Escualo through the Grand Canyon, using the fate of the Colorado River—recently designated the most endangered river in the United States by American Rivers—to show them what it means to dam a river and what is at stake in their home region. This will be the first time the young kayakers will have seen a large dam first hand.

Detail of Map of Rio Baker by Chris Hassig. Receive a 15" x 15" of the map as one of the gifts for donating.  

We've Already Completed Half of the Exchange!

In March 2013 we led eight Colorado students to Patagonia, where they met members of the Escualos club (The River Sharks), kayaked the Río Baker, and heard both sides of the debate over the proposed dams in Patagonia. Read more about that adventure here.

Rios to Rivers putting in on the Rio Baker March 27th 2013, Photo: Michael Gregory

We need your help to complete the exchange and bring eight members of Club Náutico Escualo and their two coaches to the Grand Canyon. They’ll be reunited with their US friends and participate in hands-on scientific projects to learn about the impact of dams on the Colorado.

The exchange is being documented by filmmaker and co-founder Weston Boyles, whose first film about Club Náutico Escualo has screened at film festivals world-wide.

Lago Carrera, source of the endangered Río Baker. Receive a 12" x 36" print as as one of gifts for donating.  

In the same way that few in the United States knew what would be lost when Glen Canyon Dam was built, few Chileans have witnessed the majesty of the Baker and Pascua Rivers. Our film will use the engaging plot of exchange to show Chilean and world audiences the intrinsic value of Patagonia’s rivers, and illustrate why these rivers deserve similar protection as the Grand Canyon. The film will also be a fundraising tool for future exchanges with the goal of cultivating a legacy of exchange and education between the Grand Canyon and Patagonia.   

The Grand Canyon. Photo: Weston Boyles

$25,000 Will Pay for Five Chilean Students' Trip to Grand Canyon

  • Bus and plane transportation from the Escualos’ remote Patagonian town to the United States
  • Visas to enter the United States
  • Transport and food while in the United States
  • Travel insurance
  • 12 day kayaking trip through Grand Canyon – supported at a generous discount by Hatch River Expeditions.

We've been fortunate to receive funding from a variety of sources, including the Escualos' home town, which donated $2,500 toward the travel costs associated with the visa application process, but we still need your support. $25,000 is the minimum that we need to make this trip a reality; we need to raise at least $40,000 by the end of 2013 to cover other operational and production costs.

Ríos to Rivers cofounders Weston Boyles and Susan Munroe and our small team have volunteered time, energy, and money over the past two years because we believe that our program has the potential to change lives and influence the future of Patagonia's rivers.

Rios to Rivers Co-Founders Weston Boyles & Susan Munroe

What’s In It For You?

Aside from the satisfaction of helping to create a legacy of exchange between the Grand Canyon and Patagonia, you could receive handwritten thank you cards from the Escualos; DVDs of the finished documentary signed by the filmmakers; an exclusive rafting trip through Westwater Canyon on the Colorado River with Holiday River Expeditions; and more! You could also have your name appear as a co-producer of the entire film!

Ríos to Rivers is a 501(c)(3) non-profit, which means that you also get to deduct your donation from your taxes.

Glen Canyon Dam with an ironic sign in the foreground. This photo is featured on a Patagonia T-Shirt which is included in one of the rewards. Photo: Weston Boyles

The purpose of our Indiegogo campaign is to tap into our personal networks, to create a community of supporters who may not be able to make huge financial contributions, but who can appreciate the value of our project and want to be involved – and can connect us to their own networks and spread the word about the value of travel and experiential education!

Senator of the region of Aysén, Chile joining Rios to Rivers on the Río Baker to speak about why he is opposed to the dams. Photo: Katie Hyman

Help Us Spread the Word!

Do you have friends who are passionate about outdoor education? River running? Patagonia? Wild places? Travel? Empowering youth? Latin America? Conservation? Do you work for an organization that gives charitably? Ask them to consider donating $100 towards a program that will empower young river runners from two distinct cultures and help save Patagonia's rivers. Ask them to post our campaign info on their social networks. We’ve even developed some ready-made tweets to make sharing our project even easier:

  • “Think the fate of the world’s rivers rests only in the hands of powerful corporations? Don’t click here: http://igg.me/p/423545/twtr/3465528"
  • “Can a kayaking trip change the world? These paddlers think so: http://igg.me/p/423545/twtr/3465528"
  • “Grand Canyon + Patagonia + teenage kayakers = http://igg.me/p/423545/twtr/3465528"
  • “Patagonia with or without dams? How a Grand Canyon trip is shaping the opinions of Chile’s youth: http://igg.me/p/423545/twtr/3465528"

Ríos to Rivers’ believes that experiencing a place firsthand is the best and most powerful way to learn about, love and protect it. We are seeding important questions in the minds of the next generation of kayakers, river lovers, and global citizens.

This final piece is the most important – help us bring Club Náutico Escualo to the Grand Canyon. Help us provide a powerful learning experience for students who are uniquely capable of understanding the value of the world’s rivers and becoming knowledgeable stewards for the rivers they love. 

Please consider donating to Ríos to Rivers and helping spread the word today. Thank you!

Special thank you to the Chilean Army for transporting all of the kayaking gear for the expedition on the Río Baker. Photo Michael Gregory

More information: www.RiosToRivers.org

Thank you to our Sponsors and Supporters:

ESPAÑOL – 

 

RÍOS TO RIVERS: APOYANDO A LOS RÍOS VIVOS Y DESARROLLO POSITIVO PARA JÓVENES KAYAKISTAS CHILENOS

Ríos to Rivers se basa en la admiración y el respeto que la comunidad  tiene por el Club Náutico Escualo de Cochrane Chile, y la preocupación que sienten por el destino de los ríos mundiales, especialmente el Río Baker en Chile, donde los Escualos (Tiburones del Río) viven.

Ríos to Rivers está compuesto de kayakistas y guías de rafting de la cuenca del río Colorado en los EEUU quienes viven y juegan en ríos intervenidos por represas. Navegaremos el Gran Cañón del Colorado con el Club Náutico Escualo, mostrándoles el destino del río Colorado—recién designado el río más amenazado de los Estados Unidos— para mostrarles a ellos lo  que significa intervenir un río con una represa y, lo que está en juego en la Patagonia.

Redwall Cavern en el Gran Cañon. Foto Weston Boyles

El Club Náutico Escualo es una iniciativa única en la Patagonia: Un club de kayak que les enseña confianza y respeto por sí mismos; y promueve una conexión profunda con los ríos locales y áreas silvestres. El programa de intercambio de Ríos to Rivers une a los Escualos con jóvenes kayakistas de Carbondale, Colorado, para construir un diálogo transcultural sobre ríos, represas, y energía. En Marzo 2013, Ríos to Rivers guió a ocho estudiantes Estadounidenses a la Patagonia, donde se conocieron con los Escualos; donde bajaron el río Baker en kayak, y escucharon a los dos lados del debate sobre las represas en el río Baker.

Necesitamos su ayuda para traer a ocho miembros del Club Náutico Escualo y a sus dos entrenadores al Gran Cañón. Se reunirán con sus amigos Estadounidenses, y participarán en actividades científicas prácticas para descubrir el impacto de las represas en el río Colorado.

Su Cofundador Weston Boyles hizo un documental sobre el intercambio. Su primera película sobre los Escualos ha sido presentada en más que 16 festivales internacionales. Ríos to Rivers pretende usar este segundo documental como una herramienta para educar a más gente sobre el debate hidroeléctrico en Chile y demostrar el poder de la educación experiencial.

La desembocadura del Rio Baker y el pueblo de Caleta Tortel. Foto: Linde Waidhofer

Su Contribución Cambiará las Vidas de los Estudiantes.

Recolectamos $25,000 (más de  $12.000.000 de pesos Chilenos) para pagar los costos del viaje a los EEUU para los participantes Chilenos.

Los Cofundadores de Ríos to Rivers, como Weston Boyles y Susan Munroe y un pequeño equipo, han trabajado sin sueldo por más que dos años para desarrollar el programa de intercambio. Los Escualos vienen de una región lejana y rural, donde  tampoco tienen los recursos para realizar un viaje así.

Todos los fondos recolectados van directamente a los estudiantes Chilenos y sus entrenadores para:

  • Transporte por bus y avión desde el pueblo de los Escualos en la Patagonia hacía los EEUU.
  • Las visas para entrar los EEUU
  • Transporte y comida durante la estadía en los EEUU.
  • Seguros de viaje
  • El viaje en kayak de 12 días a través del Gran Cañón – apoyado por Hatch River Expediciones

Con $ 25.000 dólares se pagarán los costos de aproximadamente cinco de los participantes Chilenos. Fondos adicionales han sido promedito por donantes privados, fundaciones, y becas en los EEUU y en Chile. Hasta la comunidad misma de los Escualos, Cochrane, Chile, ha contribuido casi dos mil dólares  para pagar los costos asociados con el proceso de sacar las visas. ¡Nuestro proyecto sigue cobrando impulso desde un nivel local hasta internacional!

Los Escualos a la balsa Colonia en el río Baker. Foto: Weston Boyles

¿Que Recibirá Ud.?

Cartas de agradecimiento de los Escualos; DVDs de los dos documentales firmado por los filmadores; mapas pintados a mano de la región de  Aysén; una foto del Lago General Carrera,  fuente del río Baker; una bajada en balsa para dos personas por Westwater Cañon en el río Colorado con Holiday River Expediciones; ¡y más!, ¡Su nombre podría aparecer en los títulos de la película, o como producir de la película entera!. También, Ríos to Rivers es una corporación sin fines de lucro, designado 501(c)(3) por el servicio de impuestos internos de los EEUU. ¡Cada donación es desgravable en los EEUU!

Cada Dólar Va Directamente a los Estudiantes Chilenos.

Hemos reservado el viaje por el Gran Cañon, las visas están aprobadas, y la película ya está medio terminar. El equipo de Ríos to Rivers es 100% comprometido con realizar el intercambio. Cada donación es recibido con agradecimiento y paga los costos del viaje de los participantes Chilenos. 

Los Escualos practicando trabajar en enquipo. Foto Claudia Altamirano

El propósito de este campaña Indiegogo es aprovechar nuestros redes personales y crear una comunidad de apoyo que valora nuestro proyecto, quiere estar involucrada, ¡y puede conectarnos con otros redes y difundir nuestro mensaje sobre el valor de viajar y la educación experiencial!

¡Ayúdenos Difundir Información!

¿Tiene amigos quienes son apasionados de la educación al aire libre?, ¿Rafting?, ¿Kayak?, ¿Los ríos?, ¿La Patagonia?, ¿Áreas silvestres?, ¿Viajar?, ¿Habilitar los jóvenes?, ¿Conservación?, ¿Trabaja por una organización que hace donaciones?. Pida que ellos consideren donar $100 dólares a un programa que cambiará las vidas de jóvenes kayakistas de dos culturas distintas. Pida que pongan información sobre nuestra campaña y proyecto en sus propias redes sociales. Además, desarrollamos “tweets-listos” para que sea más fácil compartir información de nuestro proyecto.

  • “¿Cree que las corporaciones grandes controlan el destino de los ríos del mundo? No haz clic aquí: http://igg.me/p/423545/twtr/3465528"
  • “¿Es posible que un viaje en kayak cambia el mundo? Estos kayakistas creen que sí: http://igg.me/p/423545/twtr/3465528"
  • “Gran Cañón del río Colorado + Patagonia + jóvenes kayakistas = http://igg.me/p/423545/twtr/3465528”
  • “Patagonia con o sin represas? Como un viaje por Gran Cañón forma las opiniones de la juventud de Chile http://igg.me/p/423545/twtr/3465528"

Ríos to Rivers cree que experimentar en un lugar de una manera práctica es la manera más poderosa de aprender como amarlo, valorarlo, y protegerlo. Estamos sembrando preguntas importantes en las mentes de la próxima generación de kayakistas y ciudadanos del mundo.

Rios to Rivers en el río Baker. Foto Katie Hyman

Ya hemos tenido éxitos increíbles.

  • Hemos guiado jóvenes kayakistas del Colorado por el debate complicado en la Patagonia sobre la hidroeléctricidad y hemos observado como sus mentes y mundos han ido ampliando.
  • Hemos grabado la mitad de un documental que aumentará la conciencia sobre las amenazas para la Patagonia Chilena, una de las últimas áreas silvestres del mundo.

Esta última fase es lo más importante: ayúdenos a traer al Club Náutico Escualo al Gran Cañón. Ayúdenos a  proporcionar una experiencia poderosa para un grupo de estudiantes capaces de entender el valor y cuidar los ríos que ellos aman. Ayúdenos a cambiar el destino de los ríos del mundo a través de jóvenes kayakistas.

Por favor, considere donar a nuestro programa de intercambio entre los EEUU y Chile.

¡Gracias!

Mas Informacion: www.RiosToRivers.org

Ríos to Rivers se basa en la admiración y el respeto que la comunidad  tiene por el Club Náutico Escualo de Cochrane Chile, y la preocupación que sienten por el destino de los ríos mundiales, especialmente el Río Baker en Chile, donde los Escualos (Tiburones del Río) viven.
Ríos to Rivers está compuesto de kayakistas y guías de rafting de la cuenca del río Colorado en los EEUU quienes viven y juegan en ríos intervenidos por represas. Navegaremos el Gran Cañón del Colorado con el Club Náutico Escualo, mostrándoles el destino del río Colorado—recién designado el río más amenazado de los Estados Unidos— para mostrarles a ellos lo  que significa intervenir un río con una represa y, lo que está en juego en la Patagonia.
Redwall Cavern en el Gran Cañon. Foto Weston Boyles
El Club Náutico Escualo es una iniciativa única en la Patagonia: Un club de kayak que les enseña confianza y respeto por sí mismos; y promueve una conexión profunda con los ríos locales y áreas silvestres. El programa de intercambio de Ríos to Rivers une a los Escualos con jóvenes kayakistas de Carbondale, Colorado, para construir un diálogo transcultural sobre ríos, represas, y energía. En Marzo 2013, Ríos to Rivers guió a ocho estudiantes Estadounidenses a la Patagonia, donde se conocieron con los Escualos; donde bajaron el río Baker en kayak, y escucharon a los dos lados del debate sobre las represas en el río Baker.
Necesitamos su ayuda para traer a ocho miembros del Club Náutico Escualo y a sus dos entrenadores al Gran Cañón. Se reunirán con sus amigos Estadounidenses, y participarán en actividades científicas prácticas para descubrir el impacto de las represas en el río Colorado.
Su Cofundador Weston Boyles hizo un documental sobre el intercambio. Su primera película sobre los Escualos ha sido presentada en más que 16 festivales internacionales. Ríos to Rivers pretende usar este segundo documental como una herramienta para educar a más gente sobre el debate hidroeléctrico en Chile y demostrar el poder de la educación experiencial.

La desembocadura del Rio Baker y el pueblo de Caleta Tortel. Foto: Linde Waidhofer
Su Contribución Cambiará las Vidas de los Estudiantes.
Recolectamos $25,000 (más de  $12.000.000 de pesos Chilenos) para pagar los costos del viaje a los EEUU para los participantes Chilenos.
Los Cofundadores de Ríos to Rivers, como Weston Boyles y Susan Munroe y un pequeño equipo, han trabajado sin sueldo por más que dos años para desarrollar el programa de intercambio. Los Escualos vienen de una región lejana y rural, donde  tampoco tienen los recursos para realizar un viaje así.
Todos los fondos recolectados van directamente a los estudiantes Chilenos y sus entrenadores para:

Transporte por bus y avión desde el pueblo de los Escualos en la Patagonia hacía los EEUU.
Las visas para entrar los EEUU
Transporte y comida durante la estadía en los EEUU.
Seguros de viaje
El viaje en kayak de 12 días a través del Gran Cañón – apoyado por Hatch River Expediciones

Con $ 25.000 dólares se pagarán los costos de aproximadamente cinco de los participantes Chilenos. Fondos adicionales han sido promedito por donantes privados, fundaciones, y becas en los EEUU y en Chile. Hasta la comunidad misma de los Escualos, Cochrane, Chile, ha contribuido casi dos mil dólares  para pagar los costos asociados con el proceso de sacar las visas. ¡Nuestro proyecto sigue cobrando impulso desde un nivel local hasta internacional!
Los Escualos a la balsa Colonia en el río Baker. Foto: Weston Boyles
¿Que Recibirá Ud.?
Cartas de agradecimiento de los Escualos; DVDs de los dos documentales firmado por los filmadores; mapas pintados a mano de la región de  Aysén; una foto del Lago General Carrera,  fuente del río Baker; una bajada en balsa para dos personas por Westwater Cañon en el río Colorado con Holiday River Expediciones; ¡y más!, ¡Su nombre podría aparecer en los títulos de la película, o como producir de la película entera!. También, Ríos to Rivers es una corporación sin fines de lucro, designado 501(c)(3) por el servicio de impuestos internos de los EEUU. ¡Cada donación es desgravable en los EEUU!
Cada Dólar Va Directamente a los Estudiantes Chilenos.
Hemos reservado el viaje por el Gran Cañon, las visas están aprobadas, y la película ya está medio terminar. El equipo de Ríos to Rivers es 100% comprometido con realizar el intercambio. Cada donación es recibido con agradecimiento y paga los costos del viaje de los participantes Chilenos. 
Los Escualos practicando trabajar en enquipo. Foto Claudia Altamirano
El propósito de este campaña Indiegogo es aprovechar nuestros redes personales y crear una comunidad de apoyo que valora nuestro proyecto, quiere estar involucrada, ¡y puede conectarnos con otros redes y difundir nuestro mensaje sobre el valor de viajar y la educación experiencial!
¡Ayúdenos Difundir Información!
¿Tiene amigos quienes son apasionados de la educación al aire libre?, ¿Rafting?, ¿Kayak?, ¿Los ríos?, ¿La Patagonia?, ¿Áreas silvestres?, ¿Viajar?, ¿Habilitar los jóvenes?, ¿Conservación?, ¿Trabaja por una organización que hace donaciones?. Pida que ellos consideren donar $100 dólares a un programa que cambiará las vidas de jóvenes kayakistas de dos culturas distintas. Pida que pongan información sobre nuestra campaña y proyecto en sus propias redes sociales. Además, desarrollamos “tweets-listos” para que sea más fácil compartir información de nuestro proyecto.

“¿Cree que las corporaciones grandes controlan el destino de los ríos del mundo? No haz clic aquí: http://igg.me/p/423545/twtr/3465528"
“¿Es posible que un viaje en kayak cambia el mundo? Estos kayakistas creen que sí: http://igg.me/p/423545/twtr/3465528"
“Gran Cañón del río Colorado + Patagonia + jóvenes kayakistas = http://igg.me/p/423545/twtr/3465528”
“Patagonia con o sin represas? Como un viaje por Gran Cañón forma las opiniones de la juventud de Chile http://igg.me/p/423545/twtr/3465528"
Ríos to Rivers cree que experimentar en un lugar de una manera práctica es la manera más poderosa de aprender como amarlo, valorarlo, y protegerlo. Estamos sembrando preguntas importantes en las mentes de la próxima generación de kayakistas y ciudadanos del mundo.
Rios to Rivers en el río Baker. Foto Katie Hyman
Ya hemos tenido éxitos increíbles.

Hemos guiado jóvenes kayakistas del Colorado por el debate complicado en la Patagonia sobre la hidroeléctricidad y hemos observado como sus mentes y mundos han ido ampliando.
Hemos grabado la mitad de un documental que aumentará la conciencia sobre las amenazas para la Patagonia Chilena, una de las últimas áreas silvestres del mundo.
Esta última fase es lo más importante: ayúdenos a traer al Club Náutico Escualo al Gran Cañón. Ayúdenos a  proporcionar una experiencia poderosa para un grupo de estudiantes capaces de entender el valor y cuidar los ríos que ellos aman. Ayúdenos a cambiar el destino de los ríos del mundo a través de jóvenes kayakistas.
Por favor, considere donar a nuestro programa de intercambio entre los EEUU y Chile.
¡Gracias!
Mas Informacion: www.RiosToRivers.org

story:
My Story!

Hi all! Here's my story! I'm a 24 year old single, independent girl from the USA! I have been offered the chance of a lifetime to venture over seas and teach our language ENGLISH to those students in Thailand! This is an amazing opportunity for myself, the Thai students, and the US! By going to Thailand I will have the chance to obtain my TEFL Certification through a 3 week course and then will go on to be placed somewhere in the country to teach what I know about our language and it's origin and linguistics to those fortunate children!


The Impact

As mentioned this is an amazing opportunity on so many levels! For myself I am going to gain the experience of another culture. How they live, act, dress, talk, learn, socialize, etc. But even better the lives of innocent and precious children will be greatly and positively impacted by such a program. The students of Thailand will have the opportunity to become exposed to another culture and language, and at such a young age! This exposure to American culture and the English language can help lessen the divides that are sometimes created throughout the globe. As an american citizen it is important that we display american as the land of the free and that we welcome other cultures and nationalities. Portraying such a positive image of american onto these students will encourage cultural diversity and acceptance!

 

If this adventure is unable to take place it could be a total let down. I know myself that I can not change the world, but as one person I can be a little change that can make a huge difference. Encouraging diversity in other countries can only make the world a better, happier place. Also, exposing such young children to the English language will lessen communication gaps throughout the world and encourage greater communication and collaboration throughout the world!


How you can help make a difference!

I have suggested a $2,400 campaign goal. This may seem high and with economic times being tough I understand it is hard to find the spare money, but every little bit helps! This amount was determined by factoring the cost of the course and airfare to Thailand. The course to become certified and qualified to spread and teach English to another country itself is over $1,200, but I know that if it can increase diversity and understanding it is worth it! Along with the course cost, airfare is quite expensive for the 22 hour travel that will be necessary. Most airlines are asking over $1,400 for round trip airfare.

 

Other costs that I am factoring in into this adventure include the cost of maintaining and providing a healthy and happy learning environment for the students. We know that students will learn and retain more when they are happy and part of this includes the necessary supplies and tools for educating the students. Various ESL games, falsh cards, writing utensils, reward stickers and so much more can make such a great difference in the learning experience!

 

If I can not reach my goal, I hope to still travel and spread my knowledge and affect on the lives of others. While I am still in college, and have massive student loans already, I will be more than likely taking out another loan to provide the funding for my experience and adventure. This is by no means what I would hope to do, but in order to ensure the success of such an experience, I am willing to go to such lengths. Therefore, I am asking for your help in any way, small or large! It will be greatly appreciated by myself and I am sure my future students!

Spread the Word!

Please spread the word of my intentions and desires! and I hope that together we can make a difference and impact the lives of such young students and minds! Thank you for all your generosity!

story:
Short Summary

Yoga teachers Nick Manci and Laura Brown have always felt that the people who need yoga and mind-body group classes the most RARELY get to have access to them. Since working with underserved populations - and bringing these in-need, at-risk groups to yoga and mind-body classes is where true Seva (service) is found, their new studio in Flagstaff is raising funds to provide class scholarships to in-need populations.
 
People who will be receiving scholarships to attend yoga classes and Mind-Body Resilience Training at the all-new Prana Studio on Flagstaff, AZ include but are not limited to:
 
  • At-Risk Youth
  • Populations recovering from addictions
  • Formerly incarcerated, reintegrating into society
  • At risk teens
  • Women recovering from trauma, abuse & eating disorders
  • Iraq and Afghanistan Veterans
  • - and many other groups who need support reintegrating into communities, whether in the form of finding thei purpose, healing trauma, or building resilience.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We are basically raising funds to cover our costs - studio space rental and mat space to provide individuals with the opportunity to take classes at no out-of-pocket cost - i.e, scholarships!
  • We have SO many amazing perks for our donors - including passes to the Sedona Yoga Festival (this coming weekend!), passes to the Flagstaff Yoga festival (in August), Downloads of Nick's One Breath Yoga DVDs, studio sponsorships, and public class passes for all the other yoga and MBRT classes happening at Prana Studio - this is THE best deal on all of these passes you will find anywhere!
  • If we don't reach our goal, that just means we'll be able to provide a few scholarships rather than hundreds - we'll still use the funds for scholarships, though, so all good :) Every dollar helps - Muchas muchas gracias, everyone!

SEE MORE about our new Studio - including our new schedule of classes starting on february 11th - by visiting www.YogaFlagstaff.com

The Impact

Mind-Body Resilience Training (MBRT) has been successfully implemented by Nick Manci with the U.S. Marine Corps, and previous to that his work was taken into prisons in Portland, Oregon - providing men a means to effectively build resilience, release trauma, and re-discover their purpose and their valuable roles as men in their communities. Bringing it to more at-risk and in-need groups to strengthen the community of Flagstaff from the inside out helps everyone!

Working with teen mothers and women recovering from eating disorders have been causes that Laura has held dear to her heart since taking her teacher training 7 years' ago. Directing the Flagstaff Yoga Festival for 5 years provided a great means of supporting these women, but helping them through yoga year-round has always been a dream. Scholarships can make it reality!

Other Ways You Can Help

if you cannot donate, don't want the absolute BEST DEAL on yoga festival passes, studio passes and sponsorships that you will ever find whilst helping the community of Flagstaff's most in-need groups, that's fine - we know you still love us. Just remember to help us out in any way you can NOW - this week is all we have! SHARE this campaign with your facebook followers and email this to everyone you know! THANK YOU EVERYONE for your help!

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
Short Summary…

The Foundation for Human Movement Studies has partnered with Indiegogo to develop a fundraising campaign to develop scholarship support for a week long developmental movement intensive lead by Jeff Tunkey, a graduate of the Spacial Dynamics Institute®. The learning goal of this pedagogical course is to enrich and enliven teaching approaches, starting with the insights of Rudolf Steiner a century ago and then linking these to more recent research and methods including those taught by Jaimen McMillan the founder of the Spacial Dynamics Institute®.  The intensive will examine the foundations of healthy development that occur through movement, and experience how these foundations can be joyfully built through ‘old time’ gym, schoolyard and backyard games once played by children all over the world. Many of these activities are in books for teachers and recreation directors published between 1910 and 1950. The intensive is scheduled for June 23rd 2013 through June 30th , 2013 at the Aurora Waldorf School  near Buffalo, NY.  Each day will include five hours of movement and two hours of supporting pedagogical theory.

For more details or to sign up for the course please visit www.movementforchildhood.com

For a registration form please visit http://www.movementforchildhood.com/intensive.pdf

 

A little about Jeff…

 Jeff Tunkey is a graduate of the Spacial Dynamics Institute® IS 3 (class of 1999). Since 1994, Jeff has taught both Physical Education and Extra Lesson at Aurora Waldorf School.  He has also worked with teacher groups through the Association for a Healing Education, the HEART Program in Toronto, and at other Waldorf and public schools. Jeff has worked as an Educational Support Team Coordinator, Faculty Chair and Board President at Aurora Waldorf School, and is a Board member of the Association for a Healing Education.  In addition, Jeff maintains a website that is a resource of movement ideas for teachers and parents at  www.movementforchildhood.com

 

What you can help us achieve…

In Jeff’s own words: “I began teaching in my mid-40's; I'm now 65. I believe that the curriculum I've built up over the years is one that strengthens students' foundations for learning and for a lifelong appreciation of movement. Before I retire I would like to pass along what I've learned - both the activities and the deeper understanding of their importance for the future of childhood.”

A childhood rich in varied play and movement strengthens the developmental foundations needed for success in the grades and beyond. Through age-appropriate movement, the child gains basics like: postural control; spatial orientation; movement coordination; the ability to change sight perception instantaneously between three-dimensional and two-dimensional space; good body geography; and confirmed dominance. From early childhood through high school, experience has shown that classes of students who are provided with appropriate daily movement activities are able to move ahead more solidly.

If you would like to see more of Jeff’s work, he has posted a 3-part YouTube video of an all-school circus. The “circus model” is one example that will be covered in the Developmental Movement Intensive.

 

What is needed…

Here is a breakdown of the funding needed to supports scholarships for a week long Developmental Movement intensive with Jeff Tunkey: 

$1,750 – Five Partial Scholarships ($350 each)

$3,500 – Five Full Scholarships ($700 each)

$606 - Indiegogo and Credit Card surcharges

$525 - FHMS Overhead 

$6,381 - Total Request* 

 

* Additional funding beyond $6,381 could help support additional scholarships for future courses.

 

Other Ways You Can Help…

Even if you can’t make a financial contribution at the moment, it doesn’t mean you can't help. We would like to get this word out about this Developmental Movement Intensive with Jeff Tunkey.  The intensive is scheduled for June 23rd, 2013 through June 30th, 2013 at the Aurora Waldorf School  near Buffalo, NY and if you or  someone you know may be interested in attending this Developmental Movement Intensive please visit www.movementforchildhood.com to sign up.

Lastly, if you have friends, family, or colleagues who may be motivated to see this project a success, please forward this address to them so they can help support us: www.indiegogo.com/developmetntal-movement

story:
Scarsdale Strings Cares Hosts

Give the Gift of Music

Saturday, March 15, 7:30-10pm

at Vintology Wine & Spirits, 2 Palmer Avenue, Scarsdale, NY


An evening of giving, wine tasting & a performance by the Scarsdale Strings Jazz Quartet.


Proceeds to Benefit Music Programming at the Beacon @ PS 8.

Partner Schools include the Bronx Charter School for Better Learning, Children's Aid College Preparatory Charter School and PS 55 in the Bronx.


Our Mission:

The Scarsdale Strings Cares, Inc. program is fundamentally changing current music education policy by forging partnerships with charities and private donors to provide turnkey music programs to fiscally challenged schools.  See News12's Emmy Nominated Documentary by Tara Rosenblum and Doug Pawlikowski about Scarsdale Strings Cares below:

http://www.youtube.com/results?search_query=scarsdale%20strings%20news%2012&sm=3


Featured Silent Auction Item

An Evening With Joshua Bell: 2 Tickets to Joshua Bell at Lincoln Center on March, 26, 2014.  Backstage meet & greet with Joshua Bell.  4 CDs. 2 Signed Joshua Bell Souvenir T-Shirts.


Tickets

$50 (Includes Wine, Hors D'Oeuvres, Music Performance)

Additional Levels of Giving Will Directly Further In-School Music Programming

story:
"Here I am God, Send Me"

My passoin in life is to reach those who have never heard the gospel. Who knew some 19- year old retail sales/college student woud have an opportunity to go to Australia! I can't believe it either. Going to YWAM I will be definitely taken out of my comfort zone, but I'm okay with that! 

What I need:

I need to raise $6,000 by the time I leave July 4, 2013. I will be going to Byron Bay, Australia. I have many fundraisers set in place to help me reach my goal. I need your help as well. Any amount of donations will help! I truly believe God can multiply. "All things are possible!" 

$2,000- Round trip Plane ticket

$4,000- Outreach phase (That covers my transportaion, living, food, accomodations, ect.)

The Impact

By giving you're investing not only in my life but also in the Kingdom of God. Anything my team of nine students and I do for the Kingdom, will go towards your treasure in Heaven. 

This past summer, I went to India and God went with us! I have several stories but not enough room to write them all. However, I would like to share with you one story while  I was in India. My team of eight and I went to the slum in the very poorest part of Pune to pick up trash. I have never experienced anything like that before the smell, the sight of it, words can't explain. We were touching things that were in some cases unknown to us. The people in the slums and the community couldn't believe we were doing that, some even felt ashamed that the Americans would come to clean up the mess. We wanted to set an example on how Christ wants us to keep not only our homes clean but our hearts also. By the end of the day newspaper reporters came from two stations came and we ended up on the front page of a few newspapers. Because of this testimonial act of service the slums of Pune now have weekly trash pick-ups. Cleaning the slums, a simple act of kindness, has impacted millions of people. Through those newspapers millions were able to see our purpose in going, which was to "Make God Known." 

If you invested in that trip you will forever be rewarded.  A permanant ministry has now be established in that area.    

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't financially support me, I ask that you keep me in your prayers. 

I also ask that you share this video and page with others so that they may also have the opportunity to invest in the Kingdom of God. 

Bless you and thank you!!!
-Hannah L-

 

P.S. If your interested in my blog, it is "www.lifeinaustraliaa.wordpress.com"

story:
White Pine Stables Therapeutic Riding Center (WPS) may have to close it's doors before realizing it's full potential.  We need to raise funds to pay the mortgage, feed the horses and buy some time while we redouble our efforts in fundraising.  We won't abandon our students so we need help to stay afloat while we work on a permanent solution.

Who We Are

Founded in 2007, WPS is an established nonprofit 501(3)(c) organization dedicated to serving children and adults with special needs.  We follow the most stringent safety standards in the industry, established by the Professional Association of Therapeutic Horsemanship International, or PATH Intl.  Our students come with a variety of disabilities including autism, developmental delays, birth defects, cerebral palsy, hearing impairment, speech disorders and epilepsy. By forming a special relationship with horses, students with cognitive, social, physical, and emotional disabilities are able to achieve impressive gains in these areas. 

WPS is unique in Central Ohio. We only serve people with disabilities.  We're not a for profit stable with show horses, lessons and boarders, we focus on therapy riding and helping our students overcome personal challenges.  We keep our lesson fees low so that our already financially stressed families can afford the program.  We rely solely on fundraising events and private donations and everyone that "works" here is a volunteer.   Our founder, Christy Richmond, has personally funded WPS for years.  Our lessons take place in the beautiful wooded acreage and indoor arena that she built for her own use.  Back in 2007, a life threatening accident, (a kick from a horse split her liver), caused Christy to reevaluate her priorities, to leave her stressful but high paying career in medical sales and do something she'd wanted to do for years, heal kids with horses.

I've been an instructor, volunteer and fundraiser at WPS for 4 years.  To my students, I'm Miss Amy.  To me, they are a joy and an inspiration.  Thirteen year old Alicia was born with cerebral palsy.  Her stiff, spastic limbs make just getting her on horseback a difficult task.  That doesn't matter, her absolute love for horses is what gets her on and we usually laugh all through her lesson!  Afterwards, her muscles and joints are looser thanks to the horse's rolling walk.  Her body gets quite a work out just keeping itself centered on his back and her mom has to cajole her to leave the barn, stop brushing "Chip" and let him go have dinner!  

I've had many wonderful students over the years, some who laugh with me like Alicia and others who can't communicate as much with me as they can with the horse.  We have students who have learned to ride well and are starting to jump.  We have students who volunteer to help other students.  Walt, a young man  with autism, was awarded his Eagle Scout badge for a project he completed at WPS.  When Walt came to WPS, he hardly spoke or looked us in the eye.  Today, we rely on him as an important part of our program.

Why We Need Your Help

Everything is going well at WPS except for one thing.  We have volunteers, students, a long waiting list of potential students, and healthy horses (though we need a few more).  What we lack is funding.  Christy's resources are exhausted. We've never had a big corporate sponsor and the few mini grants we've received have literally been eaten up by the horses, they eat a lot of hay.  We've taken part in some local events but not ones with great earning potential yet.

We aren't giving up yet.  If we lose the property we can find somewhere else to do lessons but we'd lose our uniqueness, our place that's just for our students and their challenges.  With no place to keep it, we'll lose most of the tack and equipment we've acquired over the years.  We'll have to find homes for the horses, a difficult endeavor in this economy where people all over are having trouble keeping them.

We'd lose our future and the plans we have for our program.  We'd like to expand into helping others with different challenges, women recovering from breast cancer, military veterans with physical and emotional disabilities, and more.  We'd also like to get everyone off the waiting list and into lessons!

Your donations would help keep a good thing going.  Help us get back on our feet financially, give us more time to seek out sponsors and create fundraising events.  We need a big bandage to help us heal, buy us some more time so we can redouble our efforts and save the future of White Pine Stables for our students.

What We Need Now and in the Future.

We need to pay the mortgage, taxes and insurance.  That's about $4000 a month. Having a few months paid in advance would alleviate a lot of stress on everyone.   

We always need to feed our horses.  A load of hay lasts about 4 weeks and costs around $1000.  We need more horses, thus we'll need even more hay.  Then there's electricity, water, veterinary expenses, the blacksmith, fuel for the tractor, office supplies, cell phone, etc.

Christy needs a salary, something she hasn't had in years.  Paying her and a part time office assistant is a goal we have for future fundraising.  We'd also like to pay for a development staff member or contractor, someone to focus solely on fundraising while Christy takes care of most everything else involved in running WPS.

Our goal of at least $10,000 is a drop in the bucket to some non-profits but to us it'll mean we can stay afloat a while longer.  Even if we don't quite reach that goal, funds donated here will go towards paying the mortgage on the property and feeding our hardest workers, our horses.

 Help Us & The Horses May Hug You!

Every little bit will help and though we can't afford to send you a t-shirt, please know we'll be overjoyed with any amount you send.  What we can give is appreciative shout outs on Facebook, Twitter and our website.  We'll tell everyone about the wonderful supporters we have and name some in our future promotions and fundraising materials.  We'll share our most delicious fundraiser with our heroes and heroines, Christy's Gram's Buckeyes, a delicious concoction of chocolate and peanut butter, very popular in Ohio!

 Other Ways You Can Help.

Even if you can’t contribute, it doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Please get the word out about our campaign.
  • Retweet fundraising and support posts on twitter.
  • Like our facebook page.

Even if you can’t contribute, it doesn’t mean you can’t help:

Please get the word out about our campaign.

Like our facebook page.

story:
If You Would Still Like to Contribute A Donation Although The Campaign Is Now Over...

Please Contact Me Via Facebook Kara Dorman. 

Also I Have A PayPal Account. The Email Is: Karadorman93@gmail.com And You May Deposit Money Directly Into My Account! 

I Appreciate The Support And Will Keep You Updated Throughout My Study Abroad Trip!!

~Kara 


About ME 
  • My name is Kara Dorman. I'm a Philadelphia resident and graduate from Imhotep Charter High School Class of 6251. I'm currently a junior and Film and Media Arts student at Temple University and I'm planning to study abroad in January to London. 
  • One of the pivotal reasons why I have embarked on a film career and I am planning to study abroad is because I'm constantly searching for another representation of black and brown stories in media. For my senior project in 2011, I researched and learned of the detrimental causes of skin bleaching in the African Diaspora and the world. I was shocked to learn the role that television, film and advertisements played into formulating self hatred images. During this time, I began to understand the importance of media and its role in shaping a society.

About ME 
My name is Kara Dorman. I'm a Philadelphia resident and graduate from Imhotep Charter High School Class of 6251. I'm currently a junior and Film and Media Arts student at Temple University and I'm planning to study abroad in January to London. 
One of the pivotal reasons why I have embarked on a film career and I am planning to study abroad is because I'm constantly searching for another representation of black and brown stories in media. For my senior project in 2011, I researched and learned of the detrimental causes of skin bleaching in the African Diaspora and the world. I was shocked to learn the role that television, film and advertisements played into formulating self hatred images. During this time, I began to understand the importance of media and its role in shaping a society.

story:
Many thanks for making it happen!

We would like to thank to all the supporters who helped us to make the Food Hacking Base at OHM 2013 reality. We hope you will come by and enjoy the event with us or if you are not present in a "physical form" you will keep an eye on it "online".

 

Oncer more many thanks,

For Food Hacking Base sincerely,

Frantisek Algoldor Apfelbeck

 

Introduction

 
We are the Food Hacking Base (fhb), a bunch of hackers from all over the world who share the love of experimenting with food and beverages. After more than two years of promoting these concepts on some of the world major hacker events, we recently started our website and we are ready to become permanently active. We are building tools and trying out new techniques or those based on the ancient wisdom of traditional societies. Merging this ancient knowledge with today's scientific understanding and technology are some of our areas of interest.
This crowdfunder is about creating food&beverage hacking hub at the OHM2013  (Observe Hack Make) event and of course "in the online world". It is a place to hack food, either on your own or joining one of the donation based workshops. Next to that we will build and run a cookware washing area for the community and even build a prototype of a hexayurt-based cold room. We are documenting all of these activities and sharing it with the community as our contribution to the open source paradigm with the hope of changing the world for the better and enjoying it on the way!
  If you want to know more about how the FHB will be used, please read on at the chapter --The base--. Many thanks for your support, fhb!
 

The project

 
To provide the community with an excellent base for hacking food at OHM2013 and future events, we need your support. The funds we receive will go towards the basic infrastructure (tents, tables, floors), tools (pots, pans, stoves), and of course food! We'll need plenty of ingredients to welcome all visitors with exotic and exciting food and beverages and make food hacking a possibility for all, as we promoted at the last CCC camp, 28c3 and 29c3 conferences. 
 
  If you'd like to know in further detail how your money will be spent, we invite you to take a look at our OHM2013 wiki budget section.
Important to note is that any donations we receive that are not necessary to cover our costs will be set aside for Food Hacking Bases future events, next one being 30c3 in Hamburg.
 
  If you want to know more about how the FHB will be used, please read on at the chapter --The base--.
 
 
 

The base

 
As many of you might know, there is another major hacker conference coming this summer - OHM2013 in the Netherlands and we will be there! We've already had more than €500 donated within the core group, so that we can have a nice tent and some other stuff functioning as a food&beverage hacking hub. We have planned several workshops so people can join and contribute in a nice relaxed environment, leaving space for more collaboration and single projects. For one of the projects, for example, we will be makeing Matelade, a marmelade based on yerba mate, a herb for a tea-like beverage. Other projects include vegan hacking and probiotic beverages brewing, with "Kombucha cosmopolita" beeing the scary one! All this will be also presented during donation based workshops keeping to "no one turned away for lack of funds" system as we did before. We will be catering for ourselves and all interested during the event happily enjoying our experiments as a group, our capacity is around 15-20 people for a meal on regular bases. Another important feature worth of stressing is that  we also open the kitchen to the people  so you can join us and experiment on your stuff or play with your own food project after coordinating with us as on the last CCC camp. Again we will construct and run a community shared washing area for dishes and kitchen equipment. The new"big" construction project for this event is a hexayurt based cold room which would be again shared as a community project, aimed to be reused on other events.
 
So come and join us at OHM2013 and thanks for supporting us, we really appreciate it :)
We are also currently building a foodhacking centric place online as well at https://foodhackingbase.org Join us there!
 

The goals

 
€700 - The Food Hacking Base is possible! We will be able to build the basic infrastructure for cooking and small workshops.
 
€1200 - At this level it's possible to prepare some foodstuffs and promotional materials in advance. Next to that we will be able to invest in more kitchen utensils for workshops and (glass) containers for projects.
 
€2500 and over - We will build and run a modular and reusable cold room. This room will make it possible to produce on a larger scale our probiotic drinks and even work on other projects that would otherwise not be achievable.

The new"big" construction project for this event is a hexayurt based cold room which would be again shared as a community project, aimed to be reused on other events.

 
So come and join us at OHM2013 and thanks for supporting us, we really appreciate it :)

We are also currently building a foodhacking centric place online as well at https://foodhackingbase.org Join us there!

€700 - The Food Hacking Base is possible! We will be able to build the basic infrastructure for cooking and small workshops.

 

€1200 - At this level it's possible to prepare some foodstuffs and promotional materials in advance. Next to that we will be able to invest in more kitchen utensils for workshops and (glass) containers for projects.

 

€2500 and over - We will build and run a modular and reusable cold room. This room will make it possible to produce on a larger scale our probiotic drinks and even work on other projects that would otherwise not be achievable.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Philip.  I am a former 1-percenter and former Marine.  I have chosen to give up my lifestyle & join the 99%, to speak for those that are SUFFERING and who don't have a voice.  My great-grandfather, was Harry Jersig, President of Lone Star Brewery from after Prohibition - 1970's.  I have two sons 7-years-old & 3-years-old.  My oldest son has High Functioning Autism.  I have decided to let go of all fear and live my life SOLELY out of LOVE.  My background is in Advertising & Marketing - that was my first passion.  My two passions go hand-in-hand.

Our campaign is about getting to the root of all of our world problems - the lack of empathy, love, compassion, kindness & understanding that our children are not being exposed to.  We need to teach them Empathy, as I believe and I believe Maria Montessori believed that this will lead to a Peaceful World.  If you've ever donated, volunteered for or given anything to a Non-Profit, then please consider our cause, as we would like to raise an entire generation of A CARING, KIND, LOVING & NURTURING SOCIETY. It's a step in the right direction.  And this will help us fight the problem of lack of Love at the root....together we can change the world.  TOGETHER WE WILL.  JUST BELIEVE - IT'S THAT SIMPLE.

By donating, volunteering, spreading our message to friends, family, media and others, you will help us bring exposure & attention to this cause....which we believe will help achieve the noblest goal of all - WORLD PEACE.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

We need money to hold our initial conference; to help get Empathy Curriculum written; to advocate for Empathy to be taught in schools around the world; to get merchandise manufactured; or whatever YOU deem necessary.  We are 100% transparent.  You will know where each penny we receive, will go.  You will choose where it will go.  Constant updates.  This is YOUR MOVEMENT; YOUR VOICE; YOU ARE IN CHARGE.  We will host votes on Facebook.  YOUR VOICE WILL BE HEARD.  I'm just here to help get this started and to ensure the message/movement NEVER become CORRUPTED.

We will soon have T-Shirts, bumper stickers and water bottles available to help raise more money and to help give $ to the people who need it most, right now.

The LONG TERM goal is to teach an entire generation LOVE, EMAPTHY, COMPASSION, KINDNESS & UNDERSTANDING from Kindergarten through Masters Programs.  In the short term, we will advocate for this and we will do what we can to gather people together to help END SUFFERING & INJUSTICE WORLDWIDE.  TOGETHER WE CAN DO ANYTHING.  WE HAVE POWER IN NUMBERS.....ALL OUT OF LOVE

Other Ways You Can Help

 

If you can't donate financially, please contact us at Montessoristorch@gmail.com and let us know that you would like to volunteer, spread the word or help however you can, with whatever skills you have.  We hope to have our website - www.montessoristorch.com up and running soon.  

 

PEACE & LOVE,

MONTESSORI'S TORCH
story_txt:
Short Summary
My name is Philip.  I am a former 1-percenter and former Marine.  I have chosen to give up my lifestyle & join the 99%, to speak for those that are SUFFERING and who don't have a voice.  My great-grandfather, was Harry Jersig, President of Lone Star Brewery from after Prohibition - 1970's.  I have two sons 7-years-old & 3-years-old.  My oldest son has High Functioning Autism.  I have decided to let go of all fear and live my life SOLELY out of LOVE.  My background is in Advertising & Marketing - that was my first passion.  My two passions go hand-in-hand.
Our campaign is about getting to the root of all of our world problems - the lack of empathy, love, compassion, kindness & understanding that our children are not being exposed to.  We need to teach them Empathy, as I believe and I believe Maria Montessori believed that this will lead to a Peaceful World.  If you've ever donated, volunteered for or given anything to a Non-Profit, then please consider our cause, as we would like to raise an entire generation of A CARING, KIND, LOVING & NURTURING SOCIETY. It's a step in the right direction.  And this will help us fight the problem of lack of Love at the root....together we can change the world.  TOGETHER WE WILL.  JUST BELIEVE - IT'S THAT SIMPLE.
By donating, volunteering, spreading our message to friends, family, media and others, you will help us bring exposure & attention to this cause....which we believe will help achieve the noblest goal of all - WORLD PEACE.
Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?


What We Need & What You Get
We need money to hold our initial conference; to help get Empathy Curriculum written; to advocate for Empathy to be taught in schools around the world; to get merchandise manufactured; or whatever YOU deem necessary.  We are 100% transparent.  You will know where each penny we receive, will go.  You will choose where it will go.  Constant updates.  This is YOUR MOVEMENT; YOUR VOICE; YOU ARE IN CHARGE.  We will host votes on Facebook.  YOUR VOICE WILL BE HEARD.  I'm just here to help get this started and to ensure the message/movement NEVER become CORRUPTED.
We will soon have T-Shirts, bumper stickers and water bottles available to help raise more money and to help give $ to the people who need it most, right now.
The LONG TERM goal is to teach an entire generation LOVE, EMAPTHY, COMPASSION, KINDNESS & UNDERSTANDING from Kindergarten through Masters Programs.  In the short term, we will advocate for this and we will do what we can to gather people together to help END SUFFERING & INJUSTICE WORLDWIDE.  TOGETHER WE CAN DO ANYTHING.  WE HAVE POWER IN NUMBERS.....ALL OUT OF LOVE


Other Ways You Can Help
 
If you can't donate financially, please contact us at Montessoristorch@gmail.com and let us know that you would like to volunteer, spread the word or help however you can, with whatever skills you have.  We hope to have our website - www.montessoristorch.com up and running soon.  
 
PEACE & LOVE,
MONTESSORI'S TORCH

story:
Nice to meet you!

Thank you for viewing our campaign

We are Tangled Hair Techs, professionals trained in the technique of Take Down Removal System of de-tangling severely matted hair, dreadlocks, tangled hair clumps, and “Birds Nests” Syndrome.

Our mission is to save hair and preserve each persons God given beauty. We are pioneers in the development of tangled hair removal services and training.

We are overwhelmed with calls daily from people who are suffering from depression, being released from long term hospitalization, pregnant, cancer patients, taking strong medications, recovering from accidents or who are healing from illness and have not COMBED their hair for months. 

 We are contacted by women who are suffering from hairdresser mistakes, improper removal of braids, weaves, hair extensions or dreadlocks that have caused an increase in knots, clumps, or masses of tangled matted hair.

Internationally, we are contacted by the loved ones of people with severely matted tangled hair who are silently suffering with depression, frustration, shame, self blame and loss of self esteem.  They have been criticized and don’t know where to go or who to turn to for solutions.

 Please visit www.tangledhairtechs.com to view some of the letters we receive.

 Detangling Matted Tangled Hair Prevents Depression

We earnestly need more individuals to be hired and educated.  Hair loss can cause depression as well, but very matted hair tends to lead to depression faster.

 Matted hair leads to depression, low self esteem and frustration.   Hair is a major part of every person’s identity and when the hair becomes matted or severely tangled for long periods of time it affects the self esteem.  This is also compounded with the opinions and judgmental views of others.

 When hair becomes seriously tangled or matted, most people become so scared.  They don’t want to cut their hair.  Some people go into denial by allowing their hair to stay this way.  They are ashamed to go out in public or to even to their salon.  Inevitably their hair gets worse.

Value of Education/ Expansion Project To You and The World 

There is an urgent need for us to train and hire more professional hair detanglers, as well as educating salon hairdressers in the art of detangling hair.  Every day some one in the world is distraught with tangled matted hair.  This need has become a high demand service for us.

Unfortunately, due to lack of education, many salons are actually making insensitive judgments about clients that have very matted hair.  Many hairdressers do not know how to patiently detangle, they are judgmental, and HEARTLESS.

These hair stylists do not want to take the time to TRY to detangle a client that walks into the salon with severely matted tangled hair.  They take one look at their hair and say "have you considered a new hair cut."

 The Impact of an International Education Plan

Through the establishment of Professional Hair Detangler Salon Training Centers in major cities beginning in January 2013, we will train, certify and hire hairdressers, as well as individuals who are interested in learning how to remove dreadlocks, detangle very matted and severely tangled hair; tangled hair extensions, old or matted braids and weaves.  

We will extend our services by training people to provide mobile professional hair detangling services in hospitals, personal home service for people that are just returning home from hospitalizations, and homes for elderly.

 We will also educate, train, and certify salons that want to provide these services.

 IT CAN HAPPEN TO ANYONE'S HAIR

We are very grateful for your support, your contributions will allow us to educate, employ more people by expanding into more cities.  And continue to provide a unique service that can help change lives and give people hope again.  We need people who value and respect each persons God given beauty in hair.

We are talented with this gift of taking down tangled matted knotted hair through and with the tangible touch of GOD.

The shame, self blame and loss of self esteem causes most women to begin concealing knots or clumps of matted hair. This is what leads to deep depression and frustration. 

Matted tangled hair must be detangled immediately, or else it will lead to changes in thinking or mood.

***********************************************

Funding Targets

 Our campaign project goal is to raise $100,000

  • The funds will enable our team to begin the first phase of education starting January 2013 to set up Professional Hair Detangler Salon Training Centers and certify salons.
  • We will need to purchase product and tools that we use, training and marketing materials
  • We will first travel to cities where salons have contacted us previously.  Schedules and cities will depend upon funding. 

 

Our contribution to you.......

Because you are helping to give people back their hair again and releasing them from the bondage of matted tangled hair.  We want to give you a relaxing release vacation.

 

 Other Ways You Can Help

Many of the calls we receive are from women who are in tears and desperate to have their hair or their children's hair restored.  Their self worth and self esteem depend on our training to save their hair.

  • We truly appreciate your efforts to spread the good news about our project and education campaign to save lives through hair.

 

  • We want to hear from you, let us know if you need our services www.tangledhairtechs.com

     REMEMBER to use the Indiegogo share tools!
