story:
Our free preschool runs on love! Parents and caregivers learn to teach, children reach their full potential and flourish, and our supporters are our heroes!  For the price of a movie ticket you can give a family the gift of preschool.

Your Contribution Will Change A Young Life Like Sophie's

When I'm asked why we should care about what happens to children in our communities, I think about Sophie. When Sophie first came to our classes, she couldn't recognize her name, hold a pencil, or cut with a pair of scissors. Because her hard working parents held down multiple jobs at minimum wage, she spent her days in her grandmother’s care. She was unable to attend a preschool because the family earned less than $35,000 a year and could barely afford to put healthy food on the table.

When we met Sophie she was ill prepared to start Kindergarten. Her future looked bleak: without a preschool education, she was destined to struggle in kindergarten and probably remain at a disadvantage throughout her school career. Because of our mobile preschool, we were able to provide Sophie and her Grandmother with an education. Sophie learned everything she needed for Kindergarten through play in the class, while her grandmother learned to make every moment of every day a learning opportunity for Sophie.

Sophie is in grade school now. According to Granny she loves school and is doing wonderfully. Investing in Sophie's life was an investment in our entire community.

Why Others Who Care About Preschool Have Contributed

  • Children given a preschool education have higher grade averages and a lower dropout rate;
  • Children with a preschool education are more likely to graduate college;
  • Teens who attended preschool are less likely to be arrested for a violent crime or experience a teenage pregnancy;
  • Every $1 invested in preschool today saves taxpayers $7 later on!

The Play-To-Learn Story

In 2009, Leora Lazarus quit her job as a teacher and started a free program for the families that could not afford to attend a regular preschool. The program has grown from one class of 22 children to over 1,200 families a year. They call her Teacher Lee.

Teacher Lee was shocked by the number children who were starting Kindergarten not knowing how to cut or hold a pencil. Many were unable to name colors or recognize letters. This is still the reality for many children. They are set up for failure in a school system that emphasizes academics and testing. The Play-To-Learn program gives every child the tools to flourish and succeed, no matter who they are and what their circumstances.

Teacher Lee Play-To-Learn is a truly unique FREE preschool program that does two wonderful things:

  1. It gives children a fun and exciting preschool environment in which they can explore, create and learn;
  2. It involves parents and empowers them to use the developmental teaching skills they learn during Play-To-Learn outside the classroom. With these learned skills they are able to help their own child become Kindergarten ready and thrive at school.

This is Why You Should Invest In Play-To-Learn

Our program is efficient and well run. We reach many more families than an ordinary preschool program and do it for much less. By empowering the parents while we teach the children, we make learning an ongoing process that continues when the families go home at the end of class. We have big plans. This program is scalable, meaning that with your help we can reach communities across the USA that need the help or that would like to balance academics with a developmental classroom.

What We Need

We must raise $5,000 to buy classroom supplies, upgrade our toys and replace our worn furniture. Anything above that will help the ongoing operations of the program.

There has never been a better time to donate to the Play-To-Learn program than today. Funding cuts have meant a drastic reduction in Head Start programs, meaning more children than ever before are unable to benefit from early childhood education. It will take organizations like Play-To-Learn and supporters like you to get children to the starting line with all the skills they need to be successful.

Please help us give these children a great start in life by contributing today. We simply cannot afford to do it without you.

What You Get

Contributors will receive some great perks including
  • Pins
  • T-shirts
  • Books
  • Art
  • Knowing you have changed many young lives for the better
If we don't meet our goal, all funds raised will go directly into the program to keep it running. The children in our classes rely on us to be there every week and that is what we will continue to do.

The Impact

It is difficult to put into words the massive impact Play-To-Learn has on families who are locked out of Head Start. It empowers the parents, it gives the children a set of skills absolutely crucial for a great start to their school career, and there is a lasting social good makes our communities better ... for generations to come.

Check out these studies:

  • The Alliance for Quality Education provided statistics that show children who have attended preschool have a 29% better chance of getting into college. 
  • A RAND corporation study in 2008 on “The Nature and Quality of Early Care and Education for Preschool Age Children in California” estimated that high-quality preschool for all four-year-olds could result in 730 fewer dropouts, 1000 fewer children held back a grade in school, and 4600 fewer child years of special education in San Diego county alone.
  • A Chicago study indicated that children without a preschool education are 70% more likely to be arrested for a violent crime before the age of 18.
  • In San Diego county, a RAND study estimated that preschool could result in 2150 fewer juvenile petitions.
  • The Alliance for Quality Education summarized these benefits by stating “every $1 invested in pre-k saves taxpayers up to $7.”

Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread the word about Play-To-Learn by using the share tools on Indiegogo to get the word out about this campaign. You can also like us on Facebook, share our website at Teacherlee.com with others and keep the conversation about early childhood education alive.
story_txt:
Our free preschool runs on love! Parents and caregivers learn to teach, children reach their full potential and flourish, and our supporters are our heroes!  For the price of a movie ticket you can give a family the gift of preschool.

Your Contribution Will Change A Young Life Like Sophie's
When I'm asked why we should care about what happens to children in our communities, I think about Sophie. When Sophie first came to our classes, she couldn't recognize her name, hold a pencil, or cut with a pair of scissors. Because her hard working parents held down multiple jobs at minimum wage, she spent her days in her grandmother’s care. She was unable to attend a preschool because the family earned less than $35,000 a year and could barely afford to put healthy food on the table. 
When we met Sophie she was ill prepared to start Kindergarten. Her future looked bleak: without a preschool education, she was destined to struggle in kindergarten and probably remain at a disadvantage throughout her school career. Because of our mobile preschool, we were able to provide Sophie and her Grandmother with an education. Sophie learned everything she needed for Kindergarten through play in the class, while her grandmother learned to make every moment of every day a learning opportunity for Sophie. Sophie is in grade school now. According to Granny she loves school and is doing wonderfully. Investing in Sophie's life was an investment in our entire community.
Why Others Who Care About Preschool Have Contributed 

Children given a preschool education have higher grade averages and a lower dropout rate; 

Children with a preschool education are more likely to graduate college; 

Teens who attended preschool are less likely to be arrested for a violent crime or experience a teenage pregnancy; 

Every $1 invested in preschool today saves taxpayers $7 later on!

story:
Hello everyone and thanks so so much for checking out this campaign which means so much to me! 

While I was in NYC with my class last week, I was offered two internships at major PR firms in Manhattan and I feel like I can't pass up this incredible opportunity.

I'm not lucky enough to have family to turn to to help me find this axing experience so I decided to try out crowd funding and I really hope people's generosity from around the globe will help me realise my dreams!

I need to raise £4,000

This is to cover rent for three months, food, travel and flights. Rent in Manhattan in a safe area can cost around $900 USD per month and travelling around and eating can be expensive. I'm determined I can make it happen! 

This means so much to me and would help me to achieve some incredible experience in an amazing city.


Don't worry if you can't contribute anything financially. The fact you read this far means the world to me! Even if it's just advice you can offer on anything from eating in Manhattan to internships or anything else, email me! mandy_rayner@live.co.uk


Thank you so much.

story:
HELLO!

My name is Olesea. I live in Moldova – a beautiful country in the Eastern Europe. I am happily married with Sergiu and we’re expecting a baby this summer :)))

I work as Human Resources Manager in a small company that operates in constructions and telecommunications.

Every day I see Young people with an university degree searching for a job.  Unfortunately, in Moldova Young  people have difficulties getting a job, and this is because they lack practical skills which the majority of our colleges and universities don’t provide.  Also, we see that most of the families lack the possibility to provide their children with activities that develop their creativity and other skills. 

During the last 10 months I found out that I can do more for the people in Moldova. Me and my husband started to look out for a great Idea that will bring happiness, peace and knowledge both for children and for the adults.

The best Idea is to have one place where you can relax, play, work and get free tea and cookies. 

Irina, a talented  designer, helped us create the design of our Dream Cafe (it grew up in a wonderful dream). 

You probably wonder Why PUZZLE? Why the colors brown, purple and yellow? 

Well, a Puzzle is a combination from several pieces that create a clear picture. This is what we would like to do: put together the right pieces and create a shared space designed both for work and fun.  

Regarding the colors, we combine brown, purple and yellow to create a space filled with love and happiness. 

YELLOW brings the Sun inside the room,

PURPLE represents the union between wisdom and love and 

BROWN emanates spiritual warmth.

"It feels like home in our Puzzle Time Café. Here we work on our projects or prepare for exams, advance our start-up or find new team members, chat with friends or play board games. We have separate areas for each of these activities".

Our goal is to create one place where we will organize conferences, competitions, workshops, entertainments and many more activities both for children and for the adults. We want to start with an English Club for children and one for adults, a Research Club and an HR Club. Besides this we want to make a small library and a game room. Having all of these activities along with free cookies and tea, each month, 100 children and adults will have new opportunities to enrich their life.

What We Need & What You Get

We found this great 100 m² Place, located in Chisinau. Now that we have the project ready, it's time to set up the Puzzle wall, bring in the furniture and electronic appliances and spread the word about our delicious cookies.

We did the math and came up with a bill of 20 000 $.

In Moldova, our modest salary empowers us to get only a limited loan from the bank. This covers about 4500 $.

We need to cover the amount of 15500$.

We can not do this without the help of our supporters, though.  As employees, we really only make enough money to make ends meet. We could wait until we can afford it ourselves, but our friends and family have encouraged us to at least give this a shot.  

Would you be willing to contribute from $5 to $150 to help us reach this goal?

If you love reading, contribute.

If you like good people, contribute.

If you like playing, contribute.

If you like puzzle, contribute.

If you like children, contribute.

If you have children who like puzzle, contribute.

If you think Puzzle Time Cafe will make Moldova a better place, contribute.

If you want to make history, contribute.

If you like to contribute, um, contribute.

If you're still reading this, you're awesome.


Wanna little sumpin’ sumpin’ from Moldova?

Take a look at our Perks! (GREAT PICTURES SOON TO BE POSTED) 

- Handmade Thank You card from Moldova

- Your name and your favorite picture on one of the pieces from the Puzzle Wall

- PUZZLE Time Café  Founders T-Shirt

- Original Puzzle from Moldova

- Original handmade Moldovan Souvenir

- Become a Happy Sponsor 


Other Ways You Can Help

We very much understand that it just isn't possible for some people to make donations for stuff like this, but there are other ways you can help!

Help us get the word out!  That really is the most helpful thing of all!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Emanuel (E.R.) Carpenter.  My goal is not only to help salespeople and small business owners become sales prospecting experts so that they can earn more money for their families but to help adults learn to read in the process.  I started my company Cold Call Sensei and wrote the book "How to Dominate in Cold Calling & Earn Six Figures Doing It" to do just that.

Here's a little more about me:

  • The only sales prospecting expert in the world who used to be a BUYER  and a sales GATEKEEPER and still makes up to 80 cold calls per day.
  • 10 years experience prospecting for brands such as Salesforce.com, Freightliner, and SAP.
  • Author of TWO Amazon.com bestselling ebooks on sales prospecting.
  • Winner of the National Sales Network's 2012 Sales Impact Award.
  • Volunteer tutor for adult literacy programs that helps people learn to read and get their GEDs.
  • Proud U.S. Air Force Gulf War Veteran

What I Need From You:

My Amazon.com Ebook, "How to Dominate in Cold Calling & Earn Six Figures Doing It" has made an impact for small business owners and sales professionals around the world.  The challenge is that only 20% of book readers have devices for electronic reading.  So they have been asking me to publish a paperback edition.  The funds from this campaign will help pay for the publishing and shipping of 200 copies of that limited-edition book to sales professionals and small business owners looking for a way to earn more money for their families.  A portion of the proceeds will also be donated to Literacy Forsyth where I volunteer as a tutor.   

The Impact

Contributors to this campaign will not only benefit from this wonderful book on sales prospecting but they will also have the opportunity to get one or all of these extras:

A chance to make a difference in the lives of many adults who struggle with the challenges of learning to read to better themselves.

A free copy of the Amazon.com bestselling eBook "Ask: The Life-Changing Secret to Success in Sales and in Life."

50% off of our popular, 100-Question Sales Prospecting Assessment that tests prospecting skills, objection-handling skills, and more.

A chance to save $400.00 on our meticulously researched, Fortune 500 Sales Prospecting list.  It's the only list we make and use for our own sales prospecting needs, complete with the names of five top executives, email addresses, revenue, and more.

Bonus material on getting past gatekeepers and navigating through voicemail systems not available in the eBook. 

The opportunity to feel good about supporting a 100% veteran-owned company. 

Other Ways You Can Help

No money?  No problem.  You can still help by doing one of the following:

Tell the salespeople and small business owners in your life about this campaign.

Write a review of the eBooks mentioned here that you've already purchased on Amazon.com, BN.com, or Smashwords.com.

story:
The Cause

As you all know NekNominations has become a social frenzy where a person downs a drink and nominates another two people to do the same. Instead of downing a drink I have decided to do my NekNomination by making a difference like many other South Africans, I call it NekDomination :)

TLC is a non-profit organisation in Johannesburg which cares for abandoned and orphaned babies. I fell in love with this organisation ever since I first volunteered with a friend during school almost 12 years ago.

My first volunteering experience was so heart warming, seeing the kids faces light up simply by giving them some love, attention or something even as simple as taking their photograph. Ever since then I have been going back to volunteer whenever possible (quite difficult as I now live in Cape Town) or helping out anyway I can. TLC is close to my heart and is only possible because of the support it gets from friends, family and anyone willing to make a difference.

TLC has seen almost 800 babies pass through their doors and continues to provide a safe haven for children ranging from babies to teenagers. The home is run by the Jarvis family who always show nothing by patience, love and compassion for all their babies. TLC is situated on a farm and as an effort to become sustainably sufficient, they have their own vegetable garden, goats and chickens.

The aim of this campaign is to raise funds to enable the Jarvis family to continue doing the great job that they are doing looking after these beautiful kids as they are always in need of some supplies,sponsoring and volunteers. 

The Aim

The aim of this campaign is to raise at least $5000 to be used by the discretion of the Jarvis family for the running costs of TLC and/or towards the following projects (whichever is the greatest need):

1. Supplies for the nursery including medication and an oxygen saturation monitor

2. Sponsoring a year's school fees for a child for preschool - $1800

3. Sponsoring a year's school fees for a child for primary school $700

4. Sponsoring a year's school fees for a child for high school - $3000

5. Furnishing of the main house including mattresses and a solar geyser

6. Monthly salary for a local farm worker to keep the farm going, e.g. grow the veggies, milk the goats, look after the chickens - $500

7. Help build a guard tower to ensure better safety of the home due to the high crime in Johannesburg - $4500

8. Small playground equipment

9. Other items such as clothes, shoes, education supplies, musical instruments, food etc. for the running costs of the home

The Result

Any help no matter how small makes a difference to the livelihood of TLC and to the lives of these children, from feeding an extra baby for a month to sponsoring a child to go to school to allow them the opportunities they deserve.

Without families like the Jarvis' many of these children would not have survived and would not have felt what its like to be part of such a loving home and community.

Other Ways You Can Help

Other ways to help include volunteering your time or delivery of supplies and goods to TLC directly (see their website link below for more details) or simply by spreading the word to friends and colleagues or anyone willing to help by sharing this campaign on indiegogo using fb or twitter.

www.tlc.org.za

Let's make a difference, not by downing a beer but by donating anything to this cause to make the lives of these children better.

#NekDomination

The home is run by the Jarvis family who always show nothing by patience, love and compassion for all their babies. TLC is situated on a farm and as an effort to become sustainably sufficient, they have their own vegetable garden, goats and chickens.The aim of this campaign is to raise funds to enable the Jarvis family to continue doing the great job that they are doing looking after these beautiful kids as they are always in need of some supplies,sponsoring and volunteers. The AimThe aim of this campaign is to raise at least $5000 to be used by the discretion of the Jarvis family for the running costs of TLC and/or towards the following projects (whichever is the greatest need):1. Supplies for the nursery including medication and an oxygen saturation monitor2. Sponsoring a year's school fees for a child for preschool - $18003. Sponsoring a year's school fees for a child for primary school $7004. Sponsoring a year's school fees for a child for high school - $30005. Furnishing of the main house including mattresses and a solar geyser6. Monthly salary for a local farm worker to keep the farm going, e.g. grow the veggies, milk the goats, look after the chickens - $5007. Help build a guard tower to ensure better safety of the home due to the high crime in Johannesburg - $45008. Small playground equipment9. Other items such as clothes, shoes, education supplies, musical instruments, food etc. for the running costs of the homeThe ResultAny help no matter how small makes a difference to the livelihood of TLC and to the lives of these children, from feeding an extra baby for a month to sponsoring a child to go to school to allow them the opportunities they deserve.Without families like the Jarvis' many of these children would not have survived and would not have felt what its like to be part of such a loving home and community.Other Ways You Can HelpOther ways to help include volunteering your time or delivery of supplies and goods to TLC directly (see their website link below for more details) or simply by spreading the word to friends and colleagues or anyone willing to help by sharing this campaign on indiegogo using fb or twitter.www.tlc.org.zaLet's make a difference, not by downing a beer but by donating anything to this cause to make the lives of these children better.#NekDomination

story:
IT’S MEDIA’S MOMENT!

Join with NAMAC in telling the story of who we are as a media arts community.

As the established field-service organization for the independent media arts sector, the National Alliance for Media Arts and Culture launched Mapping the Field in 2010, to gather empirical data about the depth and scope of the work of the independent media arts sector. By 2013, we had surveyed over 500 arts leaders and organizations. The surveys yielded impressive and robust data about community engagement, salaries, revenue sources, staffing, and more!

We want to bring this data to life as a living, breathing story about who we are as a field, a story that you can use to demonstrate your impact to stakeholders, funders, and your communities.

That’s why we need you to join us in this endeavor to produce a dynamic, interactive data visualization to illustrate the value of the media arts at the local and national levels. Our members and allies shared data on 536 organizations and artists from 46 states, and 7 sovereign Indian nations, and we want to make sense of that data with you.

Here are just a few of the ways we envision this data can be displayed and utilized to support your work:

●  Convince funders and stakeholders of your value! You’ll be able to show, in graphs and charts designed for easy searching and analysis, that you are connected to over 500 organizations that annually reach over 100 million viewers and listeners with work similar to what you create at your organization.

●  Demonstrate your impact on the economy! Our respondents have operating budgets that total over $403 million a year. All this information can be viewable and searchable by zip codes.

●  Compare salary ranges! You can search what organizations -- with comparable annual operating budgets -- are paying for key staff positions across the country.

●  Organize key information visually! Use compelling visual data to tell your story.

This is a project by and for the media arts community. Our network mobilizes the power of community through media creation, media literacy, and bringing untold stories to light. We touch the lives of 100 million people annually. Bringing this data to life shows the vitality of who we are as a sector, what makes us uniquely different from corporate media, and why the vibrancy of the work we create for social change and creative expression is unparalleled.

Supporting this campaign will bring a powerful new tool into the world for you and give you a chance to show your love of the media arts community and the role NAMAC plays in supporting your passion.

WHAT WE NEED

We need $56,000 to make this happen. What that supports is $27,500 to engage the amazing design firm Civilization. But don’t take our word for it, look at the fantastic work they created for other clients. 

An additional $24,000 is required to support the NAMAC team for 4 months while we develop, create and publish our work. And then there’s the $4,5000 in fees we pay to IndieGoGo for providing the platform to bring this campaign to you.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

As a network, we now have social media tools available to us that we could not have imagined ten years ago. You can extend your support to our campaign by using Indiegogo’s share tools to reach your networks through Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr and whatever else may be created during our campaign. If you can take a little time during each week of the campaign to share the message, be in touch to get the support you need. If you want to see this project live, spread the word!

ABOUT NAMAC

The National Alliance for Media Arts and Culture – NAMAC − energizes independent voices throughout the media arts (film, video, digital and audio arts). Founded in 1980, NAMAC was created by an eclectic group of media arts organizations from different regions who realized that together they represented a stronger social and cultural force than alone. Their idea was as bold as it was simple: to create a national organization that would provide services to support the endeavors of its members and advocate for the field as a whole.

Today, we work with member organizations and allies to ensure a free and open Internet for creators, develop leaders in the public interest media and the visual arts communities, and biennially bring people together at our signature national conference.  We also do advocacy work in Washington on behalf of the independent creative sector, and create and publish original research like Mapping the Media Arts Field.
